Jane Steinman -- who met Rowe in 1976 when they both worked at the office of Dr. Arnold Klein (the new issue of Us Weekly exclusively reports that the children&apos;s father is Klein, Jackson&apos;s L.A.-based dermatologist) -- told Us. &quot;She was very devoted to her little niece... She loved being at my house, she loved being with my children.&quot;  \r\n\r\nSteinman, who was the matron of honor at Rowe&apos;s first wedding to Rick Edelman, has since lost touch with her and said that, at the time, she could not believe that Rowe gave up custody of Prince, 12, and Paris, 11, to Jackson after their 1999 divorce.\r\n&quot;The thing that was astounding to me, and I have to say this only because I loved her, is that she would give up children ... Because she loved being with my kids and one day always wanted to be a mom,&quot; Steinman told Us.\r\nIn fact, Steinman often had Rowe babysit for her.  &quot;I know from how she treated my children -- I felt totally comfortable that she would be with them whenever because she was very motherly and just had a true love for our family,&quot; she said.   When she first heard the news that Rowe wed Jackson in 1996 and was pregnant with his children, she admits she was shocked.\r\n\r\n&quot;I know that when I worked for Dr. Klein, Michael was a patient, and when he came in after hours, he would only want to see Debbie. He had very specific things. She was a nurse of Dr. Klein, and they became very good friends.&quot;  She added: &quot;I just think it progressed to a great friendship of somebody who she respected... Whatever you talk about the other side of Michael Jackson, he was a very kind, loving human being. And I can see that Debbie would react to somebody like that.&quot;\r\nAs surprising as their relationship was to her, Steinman said that if there was &quot;something he wanted her to do, I think she would&apos;ve done it for him.&quot;\r\n\r\nLast week, Rowe&apos;s attorney said that she &quot;has not reached a final decision concerning the custody proceedings,&quot; but Steinman believes Rowe would be a good parent to Jackson&apos;s older kids.  &quot;She&apos;d be a great mother to them,&quot; she told Us. &quot;I think she has all those inborn qualities of being an excellent mother. It would probably be a different upbringing than what they&apos;ve gone through. I don&apos;t even know what her wishes would be at this point.&quot;\r\nA guardianship hearing scheduled for Monday has been postponed until July 13 at the request of attorneys for Rowe and Katherine Jackson, who remains the temporary legal guardian of Prince, Paris and Blanket, 7.", "isPartOf": {"@id": According to reports, Debbie Rowe, the mother of the Michael&apos;s eldest children, will get visitation, but no extra money.\nThough he did not go into specifics, Katherine&apos;s attorney Londell McMillan said on CBS&apos; The Early Show Thursday: &quot;It&apos;s an agreement, an agreement for the best interests of the children. This is not a money deal. This is not about money.&quot;\nSee photos of Michael Jackson&apos;s kids through the years\nSince the singer&apos;s June 25 death, 79-year-old Katherine Jackson has remained in control of the three children, Prince, 12, Paris, 11, and Blanket, 7. Rowe has sent mixed signals on whether she wants to be the children&apos;s guardian.   \nNBC&apos;s Today show reports that under the new deal, Rowe, who will not receive any extra money, will retain her parental rights but has agreed not to claim custody.\nSee 32 photos from inside Michael Jackson&apos;s Staples Center memorial\nNBC also reports that Prince and Paris know Rowe is their mother, and as a central part of the agreement, they will begin to have a relationship with her. A child psychologist will supervise the process, according to NBC.\nAsked if the issue of custody and Rowe had been resolved, McMillan said on The Early Show, &quot;We will be making an announcement very shortly on that issue, and all of the parties are resolved. There is no situation better for these children than for them to be raised and reared in the loving care of Mrs. Katherine Jackson.&quot;  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nHe dismissed reports that Joe Jackson shouldn&apos;t be involved in raising the children. Said McMillan, &quot;I don&apos;t think it&apos;s valid at all. I think Joe Jackson is the husband of Mrs. Jackson, but he&apos;s not living in Los Angeles.&quot;\nWhile Michael&apos;s will requested that Katherine raise his children, he appointed his two longtime business partners, John Branca and John McClain, to look after his money.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nKatherine receives 40 percent of the estate, but she&apos;s fighting to be kept in the loop on all business matters.\nMcMillan denied that Katherine is trying to contest the will.\n&quot;We&apos;re not trying to rewrite the will,&quot; he said. &quot;Our Judy Garland-inspired performance on last night&apos;s So You Think You Can Dance.\n&quot;When all is said and done, it was a competent job,&quot; Robert Thompson, the director of the Bleier Center for Television and Popular Culture at Syracuse University, tells Usmagazine.com.\nSee more photos of stars dancing\n&quot;She has long legs, she had a couple of moves -- although most of the real movement was done by the real dancers,&quot; he continues. &quot;It was by no means Michael Jackson on Motown 25. It wasn&apos;t even a real triumphant senior performing in her high school talent show.&quot;\nAdds Mediaweek&apos;s senior TV editor Marc Berman: &quot;It was absolutely a ratings ploy.&quot; Her appearance spiked viewership by 17 percent.\nVIDEO: WATCH HER PERFORMANCE\n &quot;Truth be told, this is not really her kind of thing -- she&apos;s an actress, she&apos;s not known for her singing and dancing. It&apos;s sort of like saying Simon Cowell is going to make a guest appearance on CSI and be a dramatic actor,&quot; he went on.  \nSee all of Katie&apos;s characters over the years\nEven though her appearance was &quot;a little bizarre,&quot; her &quot;intentions were good,&quot; Berman says, pointing out that she brought attention to Dizzy Feet Foundation, which provides dance scholarships to underprivileged kids.\n(But, he adds, &quot;I&apos;m surprised Tom Cruise wasn&apos;t in the audience clapping and jumping off a couch!&quot;)  \nUs Weekly TV editor John Griffiths wasn&apos;t too hard on Holmes.\nLook back at Katie&apos;s craziest hairstyles\n&quot;She can sing, she can do a high kick, she&apos;s got great gams, she looked fantastic!&quot; he enthuses. &quot;But I was very disappointed it was canned. Why even bother with the headset -- it was obvious it wasn&apos;t live!&quot;\nThompson didn&apos;t slam Holmes for lip-syncing, although he did point out she wasn&apos;t &quot;terribly good&quot; at it.\n&quot;In a production like that, it&apos;s relatively standard,&quot; he added.\nHolmes performance doesn&apos;t compare to another dance disaster.   &quot;I have not seen the kind of vibe after Britney Spears VMA performance,&quot; Thompson says. &quot;There&apos;s some people griping about it, but a lot of people are giving it a general, &apos;alright, whatever.&apos;&quot;\nLook back at Britney&apos;s biggest scandals\nIn the end, Berman says he doesn&apos;t think Holmes moves will &quot;help or hurt&quot; her career.  &quot;Does she want to be the next Judy Garland?&quot; questions shows shot in the days before the King of Pop&apos;s June 25 death.   Tickets for the flick go on sale Sept. 27, Sony stated in a news release Thursday.\n&quot;Audiences will be given a privileged and private look at the singer, dancer, filmmaker, architect, and genius as he creates and perfects his final show,&quot; Sony said.  It will also offer select sequences in 3-D and feature interviews with some of Jackson&apos;s closest friends and creative collaborators.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments. \nKenny Ortega, who was working with Jackson to create the &quot;This Is It&quot; concert, is also directing the documentary.  &quot;As we began assembling the footage for the motion picture, we realized we captured something extraordinary, unique and very special,&quot; Ortega said. &quot;It&apos;s a very private, exclusive look into a creative genius&apos; world.&quot;  The late singer died three weeks before the planned debut of his limited-engagement tour, and Ortega said it &quot;may go down as the greatest concert that no one got a chance to see.&quot;   \nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids through the years.\nHe added: &quot;But with this film, we get a rare portrait of Michael as he prepares for his final curtain call and what I believe was going to be his master work.&quot;\nSony began editing the film last week after concert promoter AEG Live handed over 100 hours of video it shot from April through June.  A final cut of the film must be screened for representatives of his estate no later than Oct. 2, must be rated PG and cannot include material that &quot;presents Michael Jackson in a negative light,&quot; according to the contract approved by L.A. Superior Court Judge Mitchell Beckloff earlier this month. Until now, the pair only saw each other in secret.   (Us Weekly broke the news of their relationship after spotting the pair on a three-hour tryst at a Malibu Beach Inn last March, but they have since been spotted together at a bar during an L.A. Lakers game and outside the Malibu home of Rimes&apos; longtime friend.)  \nSee more photos of stars who hooked up on set.\nTheir day on the green comes one month after Rimes, 26, separated from her husband of seven years, Dean Sheremet. Around the same time, Cibrian&apos;s wife, Brandi Glanville, left him in light of the fling. Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie both scored Golden Globe nominations, it was announced Thursday.\nPitt is up for Best Performance by an Actor in a Drama for his role in The Curious Case of Benjamin Button, while Jolie scored a nod for her part in the Clint Eastwood drama Changeling.  \nSee how Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie spent 2008.\nThe other noteworthy nomination went to Heath Ledger, who earned a posthumous nod for his role at the Joker in The Dark Knight.  \nLook back at Heath Ledger&apos;s life.\nThere were some surprises: Tom Cruise and Robert Downey Jr. were nominated for the comedy Tropic Thunder and James Franco got a nod for the pot comedy Pineapple Express.  Director Gus Van Sant&apos;s critically praised gay-rights biopic Milk was noticeably left off the Best Motion Picture category.  The 66th Annual Golden Globe Awards will be broadcast Jan. 11 from the Beverly Hilton at 8 p.m. on NBC.   Scroll down to see the nomination list of top movie categories. Jolie writes, pointing out that &quot;millions of people have been displaced&quot; and &quot;hundreds of thousands have been killed.&quot;\r\nCheck out all the places Angelina Jolie has visited in the world\r\nJolie recalls her first trip to Chad to visit refugees from Darfur in 2004. Thirty percent of those displaced are school-age children. Girls leaving the camps are raped; boys leaving the camps are killed. They want an education; they want to go back to their villages, to their land; they want peace. She&apos;s a good friend of the family and of the kids.&quot;\r\nHe said he hasn&apos;t seen a copy of his late son&apos;s will and declined further questions on the matter, calling it a &quot;private&quot; issue. (On Monday, Joe and wife Katherine filed to a petition become the administrators of Michael&apos;s estate to ensure three children are its beneficiaries.)\r\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\r\nAs for memorial and funeral plans, Joe said they are not ready to make an announcement.\r\n&quot;We&apos;re searching to see what happened to Michael,&quot; Joe told reporters. &quot;I want to see how this autopsy is coming out, the second autopsy. I&apos;m expecting to hear about it real soon.&quot;\r\nBut Joe denied rumors that they will bury Michael at his former Neverland Ranch. &quot;That&apos;s not true,&quot; he said.\r\nJoe promised that the family will continue to honor their late son.\r\n&quot;One thing I wish would have happened with Michael is that he could have been here to see all this,&quot; he said.\r\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\r\n&quot;Michael was the superstar all over the world,&quot; he went on. &quot;He was loved in every country....&quot;\r\n&quot;He tried his hard to please everybody. while the men look &quot;lovable.&quot; She added, &quot;It was hard for me to love the movie.&quot; (She later said she was &quot;disheartened&quot; her remarks became &quot;the focus of my experience with the movie.&quot;)\nBut Rogen says he doesn&apos;t see how Heigl&apos;s new comedy, The Ugly Truth, makes women look even better.\n&quot;That [movie] looks like it really puts women on a pedestal in a beautiful way,&quot; he quipped on Howard Stern&apos;s SIRIUS XM radio show on Thursday.\nAdded Apatow, &quot;I hear there&apos;s a scene where she&apos;s wearing ... Underwear ...  with a vibrator in it, so I&apos;d have to see if that was uplifting for women.&quot;\nSee more celeb scandals\nApatow figured Heigl was &quot;probably was doing six hours of interviews and kissing everyone&apos;s a**, and then just got tired and slipped a little bit&quot; when she made the remarks to Vanity Fair.\nRegardless, Rogen said, &quot;I didn&apos;t slip and I was doing f****** interviews all day too ... I didn&apos;t say s***!&quot;\nSee famous celeb catfights\nEven more baffling, said Apatow, &quot;We never had a &apos;fight&apos;&quot; with Heigl while filming. &quot;Seth always says, it doesn&apos;t make any sense [because] she improvised half her s***,&quot; Apatow said, adding that she &quot;could not have been cooler.&quot;\nApatow said he hasn&apos;t spoken to Heigl since her remarks. He doesn&apos;t know if he&apos;d make a big deal about it, either.  \nSee Katherine Heigl and other stars acting goofy\n&quot;It all depends on how much coffee I have had that day,&quot; he said. &quot;If I was fighting ... with someone else about something I may handle it wrong, and if I&apos;m in like total Buddha mood, I&apos;d be like &apos;I feel sad that she hasn&apos;t learned the lesson of her journey yet,&apos;&quot; he said.\nAfter the remark, &quot;[You think] at some point I&apos;ll get a call saying &apos;Sorry, I was tired...&apos; and then the call never comes,&apos;&quot; he said.  \nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\nRogen said he doesn&apos;t feel bad since Heigl seems to run her mouth and most people, including Grey&apos;s Anatomy staff.\n&quot;I gotta say it&apos;s not like we&apos;re the only people she said some bat **** crazy things about,&quot; he said. &quot;That&apos;s kind of her bag now.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": Chuck Liddell: The Ultimate Fighting Championship member was dating singer Willa Ford when she competed in the show&apos;s third season.\r\n&#xB7; Louie Vito: A professional snowboarder who has participated in the Winter X Games.\r\n&#xB7; Natalie Coughlin: The swimmer earned six gold medals at the 2008 Olympics, making her the youngest female to earn that many at one game -- and breaking her 2004 record.\r\n&#xB7; Michael Irvin: A former Dallas Cowboys wide receiver who was inducted into the Professional Football Hall of Fame in 2007.\r\n&#xB7; Mya: A Grammy-winning R&amp;B singer and former star of Broadway&apos;s Chicago.\r\n&#xB7; Kelly Osbourne: The London-born daughter of Ozzy and Sharon Osbourne. She rose to prominence after starring in the family&apos;s reality show, The Osbournes.  See amazing DWTS makeovers\r\n&#xB7; Macy Gray: She won one Grammy and was nominated for four more. Best known for her tune &quot;I Try&quot; from her multi-platinum debut album, On How Life Is.\r\n&#xB7; Debi Mazar: Stars on Entourage and has also appeared in four Madonna videos: &quot;Papa Don&apos;t Preach,&quot; &quot;True Blue,&quot; &quot;Deeper and Deeper&quot; and &quot;Music.&quot;\r\n&#xB7; Ashley Hamilton: The son of George Hamilton and Alana Stewart (and stepson of Rod Stewart), the actor was married to Shannen Doherty for just five months in 2003 to 2004.\r\n&#xB7; Kathy Ireland: The former model (who appeared in Sports Illustrated for 13 consecutive years) now owns her own company, Kathy Ireland Worldwide, which generates an estimated $1.4 billion in sales a year.\r\n&#xB7; Joanna Krupa: Maxim named her the sexiest swimsuit model in the world. Donny Osmond: The one-time teen idol used to perform with his brothers as a kid in the Osmond Brothers, and later just his sister, Marie Osmond.\r\n&#xB7; Melissa Joan Hart: A mother of two boys, she is most known for starring in Sabrina the Teenage Witch from 1996 to 2003.\r\n&#xB7; Tom DeLay: A former Republican House Majority Leader who resigned after being indicted on campaign finance But I am 100 percent single, and I&apos;m going to keep it that way for a while,&quot; she tells the September issue of Seventeen.\nSee what your favorite teen stars looked like two years ago.\nShe says they met earlier this year in Vancouver while he was shooting New Moon and she was filming Ramona and Beezus.\n&quot;Kristen [Stewart] was staying in my hotel. He would visit her, so we were constantly running into each other in the lobby - and we ended up meeting,&quot; Gomez recalls. &quot;We would go out to lunch and dinner, but I knew he had paparazzi following him and I had paparazzi following me. So we literally just wanted to hang out, go bowling and stuff, and it went a little too far, I think. People were getting a little crazy about us.&quot;\nLook back at odd celeb couples.\n&quot;But it was fun - I went to Vancouver thinking I was going to focus on my work, but instead I got to meet him, and it ended up being the best thing ever.&quot; she says.  \nSee photos of celebs who are still very friendly with their exes.\nEven though it didn&apos;t work out, Gomez says, &quot;He is so sweet. their rep told Us in a statement Wednesday. &quot;Plans are underway regarding a public memorial for Michael Jackson, and we will announce those plans shortly.&quot;\nWhile CNN reported the singer, 50, who died of cardiac arrest last Thursday, would be on display this week, a source also tells Us the family is having problems getting the proper permits from Los Olivios, Calif. officials.  \nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids\nIt may be moved to the Staples Center in Los Angeles, the source says. But the source points out it&apos;s a complicated process that wouldn&apos;t be complete in time for a burial this week.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\n&quot;The family is aware a Neverland burial is not possible. The town plans to hold a large memorial later this month.\nMeanwhile, a 7-year-old will was filed in Los Angeles court today. Also in the bridal party was Tatum&apos;s sister Paige and Haylie Duff, who was accompanied by the groom&apos;s pal Nick Zano. When it was time for their first kiss as husband and wife, the G.I. Joe star bent Dewan back and kissed her over his knee to cheers from the crowd, who were seated in white chairs on the lawn overlooking the ocean. The newlyweds, who exchanged Neil Lane rings, then held hands as they walked out.  Dewan, 28, and Tatum, 29, met on the set of their 2006 flick, Step Up. I&apos;ve always felt that I was his backbone, someone to be there for him. I was there and he was sort of like Moses. The things he couldn&apos;t say, I would say them.&quot;\r\n\r\nJermaine recalled the moment he found out his brother was dead -- in a devastating phone call from Katherine.\r\n&quot;She was crying, saying he was dead. To hear my mother say, &apos;Michael is dead,&apos; to feel and hear the tone in her voice to say her child is dead, is nothing that anyone can ever imagine,&quot; added Jermaine, who spoke to Matt Lauer from the Neverland Ranch.\r\n&quot;I tried to console her,&quot; he went on, &quot;but I wanted to see Michael and I wanted to see my brother. To see him there lifeless and breathless was very emotional for me. But I held myself together because I knew he&apos;s very much alive in his spirit, and that was just a shell. But I kissed him on his forehead, and I hugged him, and I touched him and I said Michael, &apos;I&apos;ll never leave you. You&apos;ll never leave me.&apos;&quot;\r\nHe also talked about watching Michael&apos;s three children say goodbye to their father as a therapist stood over them.   &quot;I know it&apos;s tough, but I think it was the best thing to do. At first I was against it, but what do you say if you don&apos;t show them?&quot; Jermaine said of the decision to have them see their dead father.\r\n\r\nJermaine said his brother was in good physical condition while rehearsing for his London concerts.  &quot;I do believe and I do know that Mike is very strong, not just mentally but physically,&quot; he said. &quot;He&apos;s a dancer, he never stopped dancing, He was already ready physically. He passed the physical, he was strong; he was ready.&quot;\r\nBut he didn&apos;t deny reports of drug use, saying he&apos;d &quot;be hurt&quot; if they turned out to be true &quot;because Michael has always been a person who was against anything like that.   \r\n\r\n&quot;I&apos;m not saying it&apos;s right, because it&apos;s not right,&quot; Jermaine continued . &quot;But in this business, the pressure, and things that you go through -- you never know what people might turn to.&quot;\r\nJermaine says Katherine is &quot;capable&quot; of taking care of the children following a judge&apos;s decision to award her temporary custody.  &quot;She&apos;s up to it,&quot; he said. &quot;She&apos;s always with all the children, she loves laughter and the crying and all the excitement. Yes, she is.&quot;\r\nJermaine said he wanted Michael to be buried at Neverland Ranch, even though his view of his former home had changed after the child molestation trial.  \r\n\r\n&quot;He was hurt, he was torn apart, and to be treated like you&apos;re not from here, to be made a mockery for the world to see, he felt that they sort of invaded his privacy,&quot; Jackson said. &quot;A place that was so beautiful -- [to] turn it into something so ugly.&quot;\r\nOn Wednesday, a Jackson family spokesperson told Usmagazine.com no official memorial would take place at the famed estate.\r\n&quot;Contrary to previous news reports, the Jackson family is officially stating that there will be no public or private viewing at Neverland,&quot; the rep said. &quot;Plans are underway regarding a public memorial for Michael Jackson, and we will announce those plans shortly.&quot;  \r\nFor more details on Michael Jackson&apos;s shocking home life with his three children, how the Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "\"She just looked at us with a slight smile,\" he says, \"then all the machines flat lined\"", "articleBody": "Ryan O&apos;Neal is speaking out for the first time since Farrah Fawcett&apos;s June 25 death in a new television interview with Today&apos;s Meredith Vieira.\r\nIn the interview airing Tuesday on NBC, O&apos;Neal, 68, opens up to Vieira about his final moments with Fawcett, who died at age 62 after battling anal cancer.\r\nLook back at the life of Farrah Fawcett.\r\n&quot;[Doctors] thought that she would live just another couple of hours, and she lived a couple of days,&quot; O&apos;Neal says of his longtime love, who spent her last days at St. John&apos;s Hospital in Santa Monica, Calif. &quot;So I had a bed put in the room for me. And I just lay by her side. She wouldn&apos;t -- move on. She wouldn&apos;t pass.&quot;\r\nIn her dying moments, &quot;[Farrah] just looked at us with a slight smile,&quot; O&apos;Neal says, &quot;and then all the machines flat lined. She was gone.&quot;\r\nRemember the stars who died last year.\r\nThough O&apos;Neal was by Fawcett&apos;s side at the time of her death, the couple&apos;s 24-year-old son, Redmond, remained incarcerated for felony drug possession. He was able to attend her funeral, serving as a pall bearer, but did not get to say goodbye in person at the hospital.\r\nOf Redmond&apos;s last phone call with his mother, O&apos;Neal tells Vieira: &quot;I think it was about regret.  And the horror of not being able to see her again, and the promise of a good life -- one she would be proud of. He has a wonderful plan in mind to restore order in his life.  And he will, with my help.&quot;\r\nSee the day&apos;s top celeb news photos.\r\nIn the weeks since her passing, O&apos;Neal says he has remained upbeat -- and is touched by the outpouring of support from Fawcett&apos;s fans.  &quot;[In her final moments], I said I&apos;d see her soon, and I see her every day. I write to her in my journal,&quot; O&apos;Neal tells Vieira. &quot;Redmond says it&apos;s harder to grieve, but I told him to be patient. And when he got out, we&apos;d grieve together.&quot;\r\n&quot;I&apos;m using what she taught me to survive, to go on. I have launched into this massive job of answering the mail that has come in for her over the last few weeks,&quot; he says. &quot;Hundreds and hundreds of letters of pain and sorrow and hope. I&apos;m answering every one of them. https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/lindsay-lohan-i-work-just-as-hard-as-scarlett-johansson-200981/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/lindsay-lohan-i-work-just-as-hard-as-scarlett-johansson-200981/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/lindsay-lohan-i-work-just-as-hard-as-scarlett-johansson-200981/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Lindsay Lohan: &#8220;I Work Just as Hard as Scarlett Johansson&#8221;", "datePublished": "2009-01-08T13:55:28-05:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:54:33-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "\"But people get distracted by the mess I've created in my life,\" she says", "articleBody": "Lindsay Lohan just can&apos;t let her feud with Scarlett Johansson go.  &quot;What hurts me the most is that I work just as hard as any actress my age, like Scarlett Johansson, but I just don&apos;t get the opportunities that they get because people are so distracted by the mess I created in my life,&quot; Lohan tells Lauren Hutton in the February issue of Interview magazine.  Johansson slammed Lohan in November for being &quot;really vulgar&quot; -- 2 1/2 years after Lohan famously scrawled dirty words words about the actress on a NYC bathroom stall.  Lohan continues:  &quot;And the worst part is, in terms of what people see of me, I have become this girl who just loves to be photographed, doesn&apos;t know how to focus, doesn&apos;t know how to work on set, just loves the attention, knows how to go out at night, knows how to party.  &quot;And you know what? I was 20 years old. I never went to college,&quot; she says.\nSee photos of stars partying.\n&quot;And I lived maybe six months out of my life like that, doing something wrong, and then I stopped. God forbid I should have ever learned my lesson. But at this point it&apos;s so hard for people to even believe that there was a lesson to be learned at all, because they just think I&apos;m wrong,&quot; she adds.  The 22-year-old says Heath Ledger offered her a few words of advice before his January 2008 death from a prescription drug overdose.  &quot;I mean, it&apos;s this business. Heath Ledger once said something about this to me. He said: &apos;It&apos;s build you up to knock you down, and that&apos;s all it is. And you just have to see if you can stand through it.&apos; And it is like that, if you put yourself in this situation. I was young, so maybe I did... I always wanted to take the blame. I&apos;ve always been apologetic for other people&apos;s faults.&quot;  Lohan -- who has already been to rehab three times and gotten two DUI&apos;s -- says she &quot;didn&apos;t even try everything&quot; during her wildest phase.  &quot;I was too afraid. The one thing I tried was the wrong thing. And maybe it was just because I&apos;d seen someone else in my family do it -- not my mother. But, I don&apos;t know, it really... It sucks.&quot;  \nSee what Lindsay Lohan looks like in a bikini.\nThe actress thinks her actions would have been more acceptable if she were in a different field.  &quot;I feel like the modeling industry is a little bit more accepting of women who make mistakes. They appreciate the idea of icons.   &quot;I found that when I worked with Bert Stern on recreating the Marilyn Monroe shoot for New York magazine...When I was able to shoot with him and do that...Although I was also terrified to do it because, I mean, we&apos;re two very different people, and I was only 21.  &quot;But when I did that shoot, people didn&apos;t frown upon it. People were like, &apos;That&apos;s a bold thing to do.&apos; People looked at that shoot more than they&apos;ve looked at any film I&apos;ve done in the past four or five years.&quot;\nSee more photos of topless stars.\nLohan says she wouldn&apos;t change a thing about her life.  &quot;If I started wishing that I could have do-overs in life, then I would never have been able to really learn from my lessons. I&apos;m not necessarily grateful for certain &apos;situations&apos; in my life per se, but I am most definitely thankful that I have been able to learn from them,&quot; Lohan says.  &quot;Not to mention that I might not have had the chance to be with who I am with now if things didn&apos;t happen the way they did and when they did,&quot; she adds. Lohan was first spotted kissing Samantha Ronson at the Cannes Film Festival last May.\nCheck out more photos of stars at the Cannes Film Fest!\nSo what has she learned over the years?  &quot;Stability through happiness, and comfort amongst loved ones. To overcome the fear of what tomorrow might bring,&quot; she says. &quot;And gratitude, because you have to appreciate life as it comes. It&apos;s important to be grateful for whatever it is that you have, because if you&apos;re not, you will find out that karma is a b--ch.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": He also spent it talking to fans and reporters outside his $1.1 million Pennsylvania home.\r\n\r\nIn an impromptu press conference Sunday afternoon, the Jon &amp; Kate Plus 8 star signed autographs and answered questions with the dozens of people who stopped by to get a look at the family.\r\nAlthough he mainly told the group that they would have to watch the show for answers, when asked where his noticeably absent wife, Kate, was, he replied, &quot;I have no idea.&quot;\r\nHe also told onlookers that he has not spoken to 23-year-old Deanna Hummel -- the school teacher with whom Us Weekly first reported he was having a three-month affair -- as much as he once had.\r\n\r\n&quot;Not as much,&quot; he said. &quot;Not with the things that went down,&quot; he said.\r\nJon, who spent the afternoon sitting on a lawn chair while his kids -- Cara, Mady, Alexis, Hannah, Aaden, Collin, Leah and Joel -- played on a slip-and-slide toy, also said he no longer goes clubbing at night.  \r\n\r\nHe refused to answer questions about a possible divorce -- which many speculate to be the announcement on Monday&apos;s special one-hour episode -- or about his recent trip to New York City to look at apartments for rent at Trump Place.\r\nHe instead instructed fans to watch the TLC series. When asked if he will still be living in the family house come Monday, he again said to tune into the show.\r\nThe dad -- who was photographed smoking earlier this week -- admitted that he struggled with a cigarette habit but remained vague on how much he smoked.   &quot;I don&apos;t smoke in front of the kids,&quot; he said.\r\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories\r\nOne day earlier, Jon took one of his sons to Reading Pediatrics after the boy bumped his head.\r\nThe boy, reportedly sextuplet Aaden, returned from the medical clinic with a bandage on his forehead. https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/iproject-runwayi-2008-recap-fit-for-a-fashion-legend-200839/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/iproject-runwayi-2008-recap-fit-for-a-fashion-legend-200839/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/iproject-runwayi-2008-recap-fit-for-a-fashion-legend-200839/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Project Runway 2008 Recap: Fit For a Fashion Legend", "datePublished": "2008-09-03T08:59:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:54:27-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Stella hits a snag as contestants design for Diane von Furstenberg", "articleBody": "Having the right to have fashions sold exclusively to American Express cardholders (with a portion of the proceeds  going to the Council of Fashion Designers of America Foundation) is not, for most designers, the dream of a lifetime. However, when your designs are manufactured as part of fashion maven Diane von Furstenberg&apos;s line, it suddenly becomes a hot (and emotional!) commodity. Such was the case for the remaining designers on this week&apos;s episode of Project Runway.\r\nWhen Tim Gunn announced last night that the contestants would be designing for a fashion legend, the minds of contestants started reeling. Tanorexic Blayne could not have been more thrown by the description. His first thought? Mary-Kate Olsen, of course! &quot;I love Mary-Kate,&quot; he gushed. &quot;I wish every challenge would involve her. I want to marry Mary-Kate. Who doesn&apos;t? &quot;Well, except Tim Gunn,&quot; he quipped.  When von Furstenberg was finally revealed as the contestants&apos; client - after a trip to her New York City showroom - everyone got extremely emotional. Kenley, endearingy, was rather affected by the presence of the design diva, and was reduced to sobs as she reflected on the opportunity presented to her and the other contestants. Unlike the other designers, she revealed she had never designed for a big-name designer prior to Runway.\r\nThis week&apos;s design task? Fashion a garment in the vein of von Furstenberg&apos;s latest collection - inspired by the 1948 film Foreign Affair, starring Marlene Dietrich as a globetrotting spy. As a parting gift, each designer was given a look book of DVF&apos;s latest line, which included multicultural, layered looks. A bonus? Forget Mood Fabrics - this time the designers were given 15 minutes to find fabrics in....von Furstenberg&apos;s sample room!\r\nOnce back at Parsons, however, the fun was over, and the designers got rather snippy about each other&apos;s looks.  Terri took the first major hit, with Blayne proclaiming that he &quot;shows versatility,&#x201D; not just the same pair of pants like someone else does. &quot;Hint, hint!&quot; Joe called her a &quot;one-trick pony,&quot; with her same pant, shirt, vest/jacket combo that she does every week. But Terri wasn&apos;t the only one with critics last night: When Leann - who earned immunity last week - attempted to make small talk with Stella over her latest designs, Stella proved her disinterest, telling Terri, &quot;You&apos;re making a dress.&quot; OK, Great. I don&apos;t care.&quot;  Kenley, who could not be putting more pressure on herself, was chastised by fellow contestants and questioned by Gunn over her choice of making a dress&#x201D; and nothing else! &quot;It&apos;s very Shanghai,&quot; Gunn noted, &quot;But is it enough?&quot;  Meanwhile, Joe, with his Mandarin-style open-back top and hood, seemed &quot;overconfident,&quot; according to Leanne, who said she&apos;s &quot;surprised he&apos;s still here at this stage of the game.&quot;  Leanne seems to have first-rate judgment because she won over this week&apos;s judges (Heidi Klum, Michael Kors, Fern Mallis - who was filling in for Nina Garcia - and, of course, von Furstenberg), making this her second consecutive win. Her blue evening gown with a ruffled back and gray jacket will now be sold exclusively to American Express card owners. (not to mention the fact that she caught the eye of one of fashion&apos;s greatest!)  However, Stella was not so lucky this week. Her poor fitting pants and jacket forced Kors to remark that they made the model look more like &quot;she&apos;s from Transylvania than Shanghai.&quot; And with that, it was curtains for Stella.  We&apos;re going to miss our leatha-lova Stella! from the 1950s musical Summer Stock, wearing an all-black ensemble similar to one Garland once wore. On Monday&apos;s episode, Jon Gosselin suggested that he may not do the show anymore, despite Kate declaring, &quot;The show must go on.&quot;\n&quot;I don&apos;t know if the show can make that new transition,&quot; says Robert J. Thompson, founding director of the Bleier Center for Television and Popular Culture at Syracuse University. &quot;It&apos;s like if The Cosby Show, mid-season, suddenly became Married With Children.&quot;\nSee the Gosselin family through the years\nHe says the show has already lost original fans who initially tuned in to watch &quot;this cute little show about parents changing diapers and feeding their kids.&quot;  As the couple&apos;s crumbling marriage made headlines, the show attracted a new fan base looking for drama.\nSee how the Gosselins have spent summer\nBut even those new viewers haven&apos;t stayed glued, as ratings continue to dip significantly since May&apos;s season 5 premiere, says Thompson.  And those new viewers likely &quot;aren&apos;t going to tune into a show about eight little kids for very long,&quot; he says.\nAdds Marc Berman, senior television editor at Mediaweek: &quot;Once all of this dies down and Jon and Kate aren&apos;t in the news anymore, this could be a problem for the show. They divorce, they move on with their lives and so do the viewers.&quot;  Berman cites Sonny and Cher as an example.  When they split, Cher got her own show; Sonny got his. &quot;It didn&apos;t work,&quot; Berman says. &quot;I&apos;m worried.&quot;\nSee what Kate Gosselin looked like in high school\nThompson tells Us &quot;it&apos;s possible&quot; the show could survive, but it needs to undergo several changes.   &quot;What they need to do is gather a whole new fan base,&quot; he says. &quot;People who will watch it with their tongue in their cheek. People who like to watch someone they can mock.&quot;\nSee more controversial photos of Jon and 23-year-old girlfriend Deanna Hummel\nProducers should &quot;stop this Jon storyline and make it about a single mom raising eight kids,&quot; Thompson advises. &quot;Try to go back to the spirit of the show - something you could watch with anybody in the house.&quot;\nThe problem: Who knows how Kate will behave?   &quot;The producers only have so much control,&quot; Thompson said. &quot;She could become a very complicated character to try to do a show like that. She could start dating, or start leaving the kids with the nannies.&quot;  Adds Thompson, &quot;I would not want to bet what&apos;s left of my retirement fund on the ongoing success of this show.&quot;\nUs Weekly television critic John Griffiths says Jon and Kate &quot;should throw in the towel and tend to their kids. They should have their own reality shows down the road.&quot;  &quot;The ratings have already slipped,&quot; he says. &quot;What are they going to keep do, have huge stunts all the time?&quot;\n&quot;Ultimately, I think that viewers are not just going to get tired of this, but they&apos;re going to get depressed by it,&quot; says Griffiths. &quot;People want a lot of drama in reality shows like The Real Housewives of New Jersey. But this is not about that. radio show, Infowars, the couple revealed they feel 9/11 was an &quot;inside job,&quot; say the idea that global warming exists is &quot;mind boggling&quot; and lament the &quot;end of humanity.&quot;\nLISTEN to their entire radio appearance here; it starts at the 180-minute mark\nThe Pratts told Jones -- who is known for his conspiracy theories of a &quot;New World Order&quot; (or, as he feels, code for &quot;totalitarian world government&quot;) -- they found out about him after a music producer gave them a copy of Jones&apos; movie, The Obama Deception.\n&quot;I really do feel like we took the blue pill or whatever from The Matrix,&quot; Spencer says.\nSince then, says Heidi: &quot;We&apos;ve been nonstop researching the Internet...for information for at least a month all day every day.&quot;\nSee Heidi and Spencer&apos;s cheesiest moments\n&quot;How are we so famous when...there&apos;s been nothing about the biggest bill since the Patriot Act being passed, [the Cap-and-Trade bill, which regulates carbon output, among other environmental issues] and nobody reading it,&quot; Spencer questions. &quot;It&apos;s mind-boggling trying to say there&apos;s global warming right now.&quot;\nSee more celeb scandals\nJones also brings up the idea of human microchip implantation to erase the need for credit cards or identification. Heidi is troubled by the idea.\n&quot;This is very serious. It says in the Bible this is the mark of the beast, and that is a sign of worshipping the Devil. So over my dead body would I ever get a chip in my body,&quot; she says. &quot;My body belongs to Jesus Christ. I am a disciple of Jesus, and I will speak out to Christians....this chip is the end of humanity.&quot;\nCheck out photos of religious stars\nHeidi also admits she&apos;s now &quot;very scared&quot; of birth control.\n&quot;I feel like God was telling me that this was something just created by the government that is really bad for my body, and I was just getting sick,&quot; she says. &quot;I researched it, and one of the founding people who invented birth control said it was the worst thing they had ever done, they wished they&apos;d never created it, how it morally corrupted society, it&apos;s just sickening to him. How it devalues women, how it causes depression, how it can cause cancer, how it sterilizes your body, and what it does to your body, how most women are suicidal sometimes on it.&quot;\nSpencer backs up Jones&apos; belief that 9/11 was an &quot;inside job.&quot;  &quot;From your research, it 100 percent is,&quot; Spencer says, adding later: &quot;I want to throw up.&quot;  \nRead more quotes on Jezebel.com, which first reported the story\nHe also compares The Hills to the government.  &quot;The narrator [Lauren Conrad] didn&apos;t get along with us. She skewed the information on the show, just like the American government can manipulate the media,&quot; he says. &quot;We used to have a phenomenal relationship with the media, they&apos;ve kind of turned on us now because they&apos;ve created us into such a monstrous thing...like they made us too big, like they Obama-sized us....&quot;  \nSee The Hills&apos; most controversial moments\nHeidi says her new beliefs will be taken &quot;very seriously&quot; because, &quot;I&apos;ve always been a very serious Christian, and most Christians understand what&apos;s going on. They understand they&apos;re being persecuted. They understand this is the end of the world. They understand the New World Order, the One World Currency, is all in Revelations in the Bible, so they&apos;re taking me very seriously and they know when I mean something, that it&apos;s a message.&quot;\nEven Miley Cyrus is in on the &quot;awakening,&quot; Heidi and Spencer say, after they put it on Twitter.\nSee Heidi and Spencer&apos;s wedding photos\nHeidi doesn&apos;t expect everyone to agree with her new views.  &quot;Conspiracy is a word they&apos;ve created to make people sound crazy, but that&apos;s not what God says,&quot; she says. &quot;You can persecute us, you can say whatever you want. &quot;\nSpencer is so changed, he says, his &quot;first rap album is going to be called Infowars.&quot; &quot;My first single, I&apos;m pretty sure is going to be called &apos;Patriot Act,&apos;&quot; he adds.\nSpencer tells Usmagazine.com of his appearance on the show: &quot;We get very passionate and excited talking about the New World Order with Alex Jones. This was the choice that I made, and it was a tough one.&quot;\r\nApplegate reveals she was &quot;so mad&quot; after being diagnosed.\r\n&quot;I was just shaking and - and then also immediately, I had to go into... &apos;take-care-of-business-mode,&apos; which was ... least one of the child stars of Slumdog Millionaire is getting out of the slums.\nThe filmmakers behind the Oscar-winning movie have bought a new home for one of the two children who lost their homes in Mumbai, India, last month when authorities demolished them.  \nSee photos from this year&apos;s Oscars.\nAzharuddin Mohammed Ismail, 10, and his family received a 250-square-foot, one-bedroom apartment, Nirja Mattoo, who helps oversee the Jai Ho Trust (which was set up by director Danny Boyle and producer Christian Colson), told the Associated Press.\nThe purchase of the property -- located in Santa Cruz West, a suburb north of the slum he currently lives in -- was completed Monday.  &quot;They can move in,&quot; Mattoo said Wednesday. &quot;I&apos;m just waiting for their consent.&quot;\nOwnership of the tiny apartment, which cost approximately $50,000, will be transferred from the trust to Ismail when he turns 18, provided he completes school, Mattoo said.  &quot;He has to complete an education,&quot; she said. &quot;We are very clear about that.&quot;\nSee which Slumdog stars had an on-set romance.\nIsmail&apos;s costar, 9-year-old Rubina Ali is also in need of a new home, and Mattoo said the trust is actively looking for one.\nIncidentally, this is the second home purchased for Ismail&apos;s family in recent weeks. The government recently purchased a slightly smaller 180-square-foot apartment for the boy&apos;s family in the Malvani district of Mumbai. The family of young Ismail -- known as Azhar -- hopes to keep both, his mother said.  &quot;After Azhar is grown up, he can stay in one,&quot; said Shameem Ismail. &quot;Me and my husband can stay in the other. Both houses are small.&quot;\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\nA spokesman for the Jai Ho Trust said that the family was welcome to keep both apartments, though a government official said that the state-provided housing, which both actors&apos; families complained were too far away from the children&apos;s schools, will likely be canceled.\nIsmail said he likes both houses. After eight seasons, she confirmed late Tuesday that she is leaving the hit Fox show American Idol.\r\n&quot;With sadness in my heart, I&apos;ve decided not to return to Idol,&quot; Abdul, 47, Twittered. &quot;I&apos;ll miss nurturing all the new talent, but most of all being a part of a show that I helped from day one become an international phenomenon.&quot;   \r\n\r\n&quot;What I want to say most, is how much I appreciate the undying support and enormous love that you have showered upon me,&quot; she added. &quot;I do, without any doubt, have the BEST fans in the entire world and I love you all.&quot;\r\nHer announcement comes weeks after her manager hinted the singer-dancer was leaving the show because there was no contract on the table.    \r\n\r\nIn a statement Tuesday, a Fox TV rep said: &quot;Paula Abdul has been an important part of the American Idol family over the last eight seasons and we are saddened that she has decided not to return to the show. While Paula will not be continuing with us, she&apos;s a tremendous talent and we wish her the best.&quot;\r\nAdded host Ryan Seacrest (via Twitter):  &quot;I am shocked and saddened about Paula.&quot; He said he &quot;cant&apos; imagine&quot; a judge&apos;s panel without her.\r\n\r\nWith Abdul&apos;s exit, the number of judges returns to three, with Simon Cowell, Randy Jackson and Kara DioGuardi, who announced Monday she will be returning. "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The former contestant -- killed by a hit-and-run driver on Sunday -- was \"fun,\" recalls an ex boyfriend", "articleBody": "Less than a week after being killed by a hit-and-run driver, former American Idol contestant Alexis Cohen was laid to rest today near her hometown of Allentown, Penn.\nDonors agreed to pay for a plot and service at Keneseth Israel Cemetery for the 25-year-old, who lived in a poor neighborhood, according to local newspaper The Morning Call.  \nLook back at Idol&apos;s most memorable contestants.\nCohen&apos;s mother -- who resided with the aspiring singer and actress in a studio apartment -- did not comment to reporters after.\nFamily friends recalled Cohen&apos;s fun-loving nature.\n&quot;She could take the worst time, as bad as it was, and turn it into a fun time,&quot; said James Kern, 27, who said he dated Cohen off-and-on for several years.  \nVIDEO: Watch Alexis Cohen audition for the show.\nCohen earned the nickname Glitter Girl after the sparkly wardrobe and makeup she wore to her 2007 audition. Her reply? &quot;I&apos;m not an Indian giver.&quot;  \nLook back at Jessica Simpson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\n&quot;I am shocked she said that. I didn&apos;t know people still said that,&quot; one person wrote on the website, theforumsite. &quot;She will be apologizing ... there is outrage.&quot;  Added another TMZ.com commenter: &quot;I&apos;m a Native American and I cringed when I heard Jessica Simpson comment about us Native Americans. Am I mad!?! I should be, but look at who the comment is coming from.&quot;  \nSee how Jessica Simpson has changed over the years\nA third chimed in: &quot;As a Native American, in particular a Dakota, I find those comments quite sad and stereotypical. But not surprising, if you look who said them.&quot;\nSee Jessica Simpson&apos;s most memorable Us Weekly covers\nJacqueline L. Pata, executive director of the National Congress of American Indians, tells Usmagazine.com Simpson isn&apos;t the only person who uses the word in a derogatory sense.\nThe concept of Indians giving and sharing with one another is where the term originated, she explains, but has somehow morphed into an insensitive phrase that stereotypes Native people as ones who give and then take back.\n&quot;Most people flippantly use the comment &apos;Indian giver&apos; without realizing its true meaning, Pata tells Us.\nPata says Simpson&apos;s latest gaffe could be &quot;a good chance to educate people not to stereotype Native Americans by using a comment this is both incorrect in the way most people use it, and culturally insensitive to Native people.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": Someone who understands himself, has already dealt with his issues and who can say, &apos;I see where I&apos;ve been foolish before and I&apos;m not going to be like that again,&apos;&quot; she says.\r\n\r\nIn the meantime, she&apos;s come to terms with herself.  &quot;I think we have to be confident and accept ourselves for who we are. I think the biggest power a woman has is over her body [is] being able to control what you put in it. I mean, look at a car- it runs on gasoline, so you&apos;re not going to go and fill it up with Jell-O,&quot; she says. &quot;Our bodies are machines too -- we just haven&apos;t been taught that.&quot;  \r\n\r\nDiaz admits it&apos;s &quot;incredibly important&quot; for her to feel sexy.  &quot;It&apos;s part of being an animal, it&apos;s part of being human. You have to feel sexy -- and I mean in the way that you feel sexy. Do you realize when I started this show, my hair was black and the president was white. Did you know that?&quot;\r\nSee then-and-now photos of your favorite TV stars\r\nHe continued: &quot;When we started this show 17 years ago, Jon and Kate were both eight!&quot;\r\nSee Jon and Gosselin through the years\r\nHe said he got &quot;nostalgic&quot; driving through the Burbank, Calif., lot for the last time. &quot;We&apos;ve had the same security guard the whole time, and he said the same thing to me today that he&apos;s said for the past 17 years: &apos;And you are?&apos;&quot; Leno cracked.  He also poked fun at his post-Tonight Show plans:&quot;I&apos;m going to be going to a secluded spot where no one can find me&quot; NBC prime time.&quot; (Leno has signed on to host a new hour-long comedy show on NBC at the 10 p.m. timeslot in September.)\r\nSee what this famous TV kid star looks like all grown up\r\nKidding aside, Leno said&quot;the hard part&quot; of leaving is looking back on the momentous events of the past 17 years - including 9/11.  &quot;When times are serious, you make silly jokes,&quot; he said. &quot;When times are silly, you make serious jokes. But you always want to have jokes. That&apos;s what we&apos;ve been trying to do for the last 17 years &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201C; make you laugh. And it&apos;s been an honor and a privilege to do that.&quot;\r\nSee famous TV scandals\r\nHe thanked his fans, writing staff, Kevin Eubanks and his band, the crew and his wife (&quot;Thank you, honey&quot;) for all their support over the years.\r\nCheck out today&apos;s top celeb news photos\r\nOn his final show Friday, Leno also officially passed the torch to Conan O&apos;Brien, who will take over hosting duties Monday at a newly built studio at nearby Universal City, Calif.  &quot;You were the perfect choice. You&apos;ve been an absolute gentlemen in private and in the press,&quot; Leno told O&apos;Brien,  &quot;Conan rocks,&quot; a studio audience member screamed.  &quot;I agree,&quot; Leno replied. Travis Fimmel, who costarred with Swayze on the A&amp;E series, The Beast, tells Usmagazine.com in a statement.\r\n&quot;My heartfelt condolences go out to his wife Lisa and their families,&quot; continued Fimmel, referring to Swayze&apos;s wife of 34 years, Lisa Niemi.\r\n&quot;RIP P Swayze,&quot; Ashton Kutcher posted on Twitter, along with a link to a Saturday Night Live skit featuring Swayze and Chris Farley as Chippendales dancers. (Kutcher&apos;s wife Demi Moore, who costarred with Swayze in 1990&apos;s Ghost, has not yet posted on his death.)\r\nWrote Alyssa Milano on Twitter: &quot;RIP Patrick. You were a great talent. And more importantly ... a true gentleman.\r\n\r\nC. Thomas Howell, who costarred alongside Swayze in The Outsiders, Red Dawn and Grandview, U.S.A., tells Us: &quot;I have always had a special place in my heart for Patrick. &#xA0;While I &#xA0; was fortunate enough to work with him in three films, it was our passion for horses that forged a friendship between us that I treasure &#xA0; to this day. Not only did we lose a fine actor today, I lost my older Outsiders brother. My heart goes out to not only his entire family,&#xA0;but all his fans as well.&quot;\r\nA&amp;E told Us in a statement: &quot;We are saddened by the loss of one of our generation&apos;s greatest talents and a member of the A&amp;E family. Patrick&apos;s work on The Beast was an inspiration to us all. He will be greatly missed and our thoughts are with his wife Lisa and his entire family during this difficult time.&quot;\r\nKirstie Alley, who costarred with Swayze in the 1985 TV miniseries North and South, posted on Twitter: &quot;I will always cherish my amazing memories of Patrick...we had so much fun together...come back soon Patrick, we need you here on earth.&quot;\r\nCalifornia Governor and former actor&#xA0;Arnold Schwarzenegger&#xA0;tells&#xA0;Entertainment Tonight: &quot;Patrick Swayze was a talented and passionate artist who struck a memorable chord with audiences throughout the world. He played a wide range of characters both on stage and in movies and his celebrated performances made the hard work of acting look effortless -- which I know from experience is not easy. As a fan and as an actor, I admired Patrick and I know that he will be dearly missed. On behalf of all Californians, Maria and I send our deepest condolences to Patrick&apos;s family, friends and fans.&quot;\r\nVincent Angell, co-creator of The Beast, tells Us in a statement: &quot;I had the privilege and honor to work with Patrick over the past two years on the television show &quot;The Beast.&quot; &#xA0;I learned so much from him over that too short amount of time. &#xA0;He was a talented actor, a great man and a wonderful friend. &#xA0;I will miss him. &#xA0;My heart goes out to his wife Lisa and the rest of his family.&quot;\r\nThe Dirty Dancing star&apos;s rep Annett Wolf announced in a statement Monday night: &quot;Patrick Swayze passed away peacefully today with family at his side after facing the challenges of his illness for the last 20 months.\r\nThe actor was she told Us at the Rock a Little, Feed a Lot benefit concert in Los Angeles Tuesday.\r\nApplegate tells Us she&apos;s launching her own foundation called Right Action in late October, breast cancer awareness month.\r\n&quot;It will provide financial aid for women of high risk who want to get MRIs. If you don&apos;t have insurance -- which millions of Americans don&apos;t -- it&apos;s $5,000, so women are opting to not have this test,&quot; she explained. &quot;That&apos;s what saved my life, and I want to give back in that respect.&quot;\r\nCheck out the day&apos;s top news photos\r\nApplegate -- who admitted she wanted to &quot;cry...and scream&quot; after her diagnosis -- says she&apos;s dedicating most of her time to shedding light on the disease.\r\n&quot;My mother is a breast and ovarian cancer survivor and I&apos;ve always been very outspoken about it. Then of course it happened to me. And I lost my cousin last year to cancer -- so its very important that we stop it,&quot; she said. &quot;Enough is enough.&quot;\r\nAnother thing she&apos;s focusing on?\r\n&quot;I am working on getting a job so if you hear of anything, let me know!&quot; joked Applegate, who last starred on Samantha Who, which was canceled in May after two years on the air.&#xA0;\r\n&#xA0;", "isPartOf": She&apos;s been a really wonderful part of the show for eight years.&quot;  According to The Hollywood Reporter, Abdul asked for a $20 million deal.\r\nShe rejected a 30 percent raise - an eight-figure, multi-year deal.  \r\n\r\n&quot;There is going to be a change and that change we have to look at that as being a positive change,&quot; Rice said of Abdul&apos;s exit. &quot;It wasn&apos;t a decision we made, but we have to look at it in a positive way.&quot;\r\n\r\nIn the meantime, guest judges -- including Victoria Beckham and Katy Perry -- will join Simon Cowell, Randy Jackson and Kara DioGuardi in the seven weeks of taped audition rounds, which begin Friday in Denver.\r\n\r\n&quot;We&apos;ll have these guest judges do one week each during the audition [period]... there is no thought right now that any of these judges will be long term judge for us,&quot; Rice said. &quot;All of the people we are talking to have successful careers. I don&apos;t even think they&apos;d be available to judge full-time. (Katherine Jackson remains the children&apos;s temporary guardian until then.)\r\nBut in 2003,  Rowe &#x2013; whose babies were born through artificial insemination (dad is Arnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s L.A.-based dermatologist) &#x2013; sat down with Us&apos; Ian Drew and confessed she &quot;never&quot; wanted to be a mother.\r\n&quot;Parenting is an art; you earn the title,&quot; Rowe, now 50, said during the interview, which is featured in the new issue of Us Weekly (on newsstands now). &quot;Because you give birth and impregnate someone does not automatically give you the title of mother or father &#x2013; you earn the title.\r\n\r\n&quot;My kids don&apos;t call me mom because I don&apos;t want them to,&quot; she went on. &quot;They are Michael&apos;s children. It&apos;s not that they&apos;re not my children, but I had them because I wanted him to be a father.&quot;\r\nAfter Rowe and Jackson divorced in 1999 after three years of marriage, she agreed to give up her parental rights, insisting Jackson was a good father.  \r\n\r\nDuring her 2003 interview with Drew, Rowe addressed critics who claimed she abandoned her kids.\r\n&quot;They say, &apos;I can&apos;t believe she left her children.&apos; Left them? I did not leave my children,&quot; Rowe told Drew. &quot;My children are with their father where they are supposed to be.&quot;  \r\n\r\nAsked why the children are not with her, she said, &quot;I didn&apos;t do it to be a mother. Like I said, you earn the title. I didn&apos;t change diapers. I didn&apos;t get up in the middle of the night - even when I was there. Michael did it all. I am telling you that he is the most brilliant father. Almost before the baby needed something, he knew what it was. And that&apos;s not for me.&quot;\r\n\r\nShe added that she never wanted children before she wed Jackson.\r\n&quot;If it hadn&apos;t been for how much I love him and because of our relationship, I would never have had children,&quot; she told Drew. &quot;And how spoiled am I? I get to go through the whole experience with a loving, caring person, and I can still have the opportunity to have the life I never thought I would have back again. I am still waiting for that and working on it. I&apos;m the one who feels selfish about having the kids.&quot;\r\nSee more photos of Debbie Rowe by photo agency X17", "isPartOf": {"@id": Dr. Murray was present during the search of his home and assisted the officers. Investigators left Dr. Murray&apos;s home around noon, seizing cell phones and a computer hard drive. As of 2 p.m., the search at Dr. Murray&apos;s office continues.&quot;\nAccording to the LAPD, the U.S. Department of Justice was also a part of the search.\n\nThe search came a day after the Associated Press quoted an unidentified  law enforcement official as saying that Murray, 51, gave Jackson a fatal dose of Propofol through an IV sometime after midnight on June 25 -- the day he died after suffering cardiac arrest at age 50. (The autopsy report is expected to be released within days.)\nThis isn&apos;t the first place of Murray&apos;s that authorities have searched. The family, who has already moved in pots and pans, a television set, and their birdcage, plan to be fully moved in by Tuesday.\nSee which Slumdog stars had an on-set romance\nLocated in Santa Cruz West, a suburb north of the Mumbai slum Ismail previously lived in, the ground-floor dwelling -- purchased by the producers for $42,000 -- is situated in a modern apartment complex with running water and electricity. Ismail will take control of the deed when he turns 18.  &quot;I like it here, it is really nice. But I will miss my old friends...&quot; the actor told Reuters. &quot;Maybe I will go and visit them once a while.&quot;  In May, Ismail&apos;s old home was demolished in the middle of the night after city authorities deemed it illegal.   \nCheck out the day&apos;s top celeb news photos\nThe Slumdog Millionaire filmmakers were moved to create the Jai Ho Trust after learning of the harsh living conditions Ismail and his costar, Rubina Ali, faced in their native Mumbai. So far, $742,000 has been set aside to set up a five-year healthcare and education program for the children.  Slumdog Millionaire, the 2008 breakout hit about a slum dweller who hits it big on a TV game show, took home eight Oscars last year and has grossed more than $140 million domestically to date.", Crawford says. &quot;He&apos;s gotta make the best choice for his career at this point, and I have to make the best for mine, and luckily it worked out for both of us.&quot;   Still, Crawford won the part on his own merit, he says. His audition, which included dancing and singing for the film&apos;s director Kenny Ortega and the film&apos;s producers, was brutal.   &quot;It was, like, five hours of the most rigorous tests ever,&quot; Crawford says. &quot;I walked out very confident.&quot;\r\nCheck out Chace&apos;s yearbook photo!\r\nStill, the actor doesn&apos;t plan to do some of the more elaborate choreography from the original.   &quot;I don&apos;t know if the gymnastics [high bar] scene is going to make it,&quot; says Crawford, who will soon begin an Ortega-plotted training regimen before filming begins next March. &quot;I&apos;ve got some movement in me, but I&apos;m not a dancer.&quot;   He jokes: &quot;I need to start stretching now.&quot;  Although Crawford, 23, wasn&apos;t born when the 1984 film -- starring Kevin Bacon -- hit theaters, he says he&apos;s excited to be one step closer in the famous Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon game.\r\nFind out what your favorite Gossip Girl stars looked like as kids.\r\n&quot;I want my number to be up -- my Bacon number,&quot; he says.\r\nAnother young star who will get the same opportunity will be Dancing With the Stars&apos; Julianne Hough. The pro dancer, who auditioned along with Hayden Panetierre, will screen-test this week for the role of Crawford&apos;s leading lady, a Paramount spokesperson confirmed to Entertainment Weekly.  Hough&apos;s recent success as a country music star could give her an advantage.   &quot;It&apos;s a much more singing-intensive movie for the female lead,&quot; producer Neil Meron says.   The new Footloose, which won&apos;t be a &quot;burst-into-song&quot; type of movie musical, will pay homage to the original with possible cameos by the first cast and the performance of the familiar title song.   &quot;The classic hit songs from the movie will be sung,&quot; producer Craig Zadan says. &quot;There will be new songs that will be written by new artists, and those will be soundtrack Just 40 pounds of fat now gone from my body, but wow, it&apos;s pretty much all I get asked about. In the last year, I got to star in a movie, wrote and directed my next one, and adopted a three year old from American Foster Care. But guess what I&apos;m asked- how did I lose the weight?&quot; the My Life in Ruins actress, 46, writes on CNN&apos;s AC360 Blog.\nCheck out pics of scary skinny stars.\n&quot;I am embarrassed to be in the position of answering questions about my body again. On the publicity tour of My Big Fat Greek Wedding, I was asked over and over again, if, as the writer, I felt it was a fair depiction of real life to have someone of my er, below average looks, hook up with hottie John Corbett.  \nSee photos of celebs who went from hunk to chunk.\n&quot;It&apos;s been years, and I have sat through many a movie like Sideways, where nobody blinks an eye when Paul Giamatti gets together with gorgeous Virginia Madsen. And, then Knocked Up...well, the visual of Seth Rogan on top of Katherine Heigl made me put the popcorn down and reach for my purse. Not because I was grossed out, but because I knew the film was about to stop and Ashton Kutcher would now jump out and go &apos;Aha, you&apos;ve been Punk&apos;d, that would never happen.&apos; I waited. But no Ashton. The film went on. And many a reviewer, who probably look like sweet Seth (yes, even the women) gave it a thumbs up.&quot;\nVardalos admits there&apos;s a &quot;double standard for women. Whatever, yawn, we all know it, perpetuate it.&quot;\nSee before and after photos of Us&apos; weight winners.\n&quot;So, it&apos;s our fault. Let&apos;s accept it and move on. Socially, the issue of men&apos;s weight is simply not a big deal. Let&apos;s face it: Russell Crowe is fat and no one ever talks about it. Alec Baldwin just orders his suits a size bigger and we continue to swoon.&quot;\nVardalos says &quot;the truth&quot; about her weight loss is that she &quot;had a blood sugar problem&quot; and her doctor ordered her to drop weight.  &quot;It was really hard, but I did it through exercise, and it took a year,&quot; she admits.\nFind out how more stars get fit.\nIf not for her health issues, the actress would have kept her curves, she says.  &quot;I thought I was attractive when I shot My Big Fat Greek Wedding. Studio executives and movie reviewers let me know I had a confidence in my looks that was not shared by them,&quot; she says. &quot;In other words, they labeled me with words like: overweight, unattractive, unappealing.&quot;\n&quot;Hey, just say fat. I love the word fat. I used it in the title,&quot; she goes on. &quot;It&apos;s actually not a naughty word. We give it a power it actually doesn&apos;t have. So, you&apos;re fat. she said.  \nLook back at Jon and Kate&apos;s happier days\nSo, as she and the boys continued their vacation at Bald Head Island, N.C., she took them aboard the USS North Carolina battleship.\n&quot;I think I got some cool mom points,&quot; she said of the trip, adding that she wanted to &quot;cry&quot; when she saw how cute her boys looked in their sailor hats.\nSee photos of the most controversial star moms of all time.\nOf her boys, Kate said, &quot;They&apos;re getting to that age where they&apos;re taking care of mommy, which is really fun to see.&quot;\nJon had different activities planned as he looked after 8-year-old twins Mady and Cara (who left their vacation with mom early because they had three days of school to finish).\nJon &#x2013; whose Ed Hardy shirts were notably blurred &#x2013; took them to a play park, where they rode go-karts and played video games.\nCara was game for anything (she even did a two-story high ropes course), but Mady wasn&apos;t so thrilled with the trip. &quot;Really, actually, I don&apos;t even know what I want to do,&quot; she said of the play park. picked up on the two&apos;s new friendship: He even joked that he would be happy if Mikey filled in for him on his TLC show.  &quot;We can send Mikey to replace me,&quot; he said. &quot;Apparently, I don&apos;t do anything -- and neither does he.&quot;\nJon went on to say that it was nice to be around some guys for once.  &quot;I like hanging out with the guys because I have few male friends -- as Door costar get married without one, she tells Usmagazine.com.  &quot;She kept saying she didn&apos;t want a bachelorette party, [but] she has to!&quot; Marquardt told Us at Melanie Segal&apos;s Rev3 event in Hollywood on Friday. &quot;She is getting one!&quot;\nAlthough Marquardt is not the maid of honor, she stepped up to make sure Wilkinson had one last party as a single girl before she weds I&apos;ve never been a size zero,&quot; Walsh, 41, told Usmagazine.com at the Blow Out Cancer event Monday in Los Angeles. &quot;Even when I was born, I was probably bigger than the other babies. It&apos;s really not a priority to me.&quot;\r\n\r\nThe 5-foot-9 actress -- who donned a fat suit to play Nicki Fifer on Drew Carey in the late &apos;90s -- says she has always been a yo-yo dieter.&quot;I try to eat healthy foods, but then of course I really do love junk food, too. I still love my potato chips. I try to eat organic, but it&apos;s ... really expensive and not everybody can do that,&quot; Walsh continues.\r\nTo combat her sweet tooth, Walsh says, she&apos;s tried every diet on the market.\r\n\r\n&quot;I&apos;ve done every diet there is. When I quit smoking years ago, I did the cabbage soup diet. I went on Atkins because I was going to have foot surgery,&quot; Walsh -- whose Private Practice premieres Oct. 1 on ABC -- has told Women&apos;s Health magazine. &quot;I knew I wouldn&apos;t be able to move or work out, and I was afraid of becoming huge. And it&apos;s not ideal,&quot; Bingo Gubelmann told Usmagazine.com at the Thursday premiere. &quot;It&apos;s frustrating, but I&apos;m not going to sit here and trash her because we&apos;re young as a company and we&apos;ve got to live and learn...I don&apos;t want to be known as the producer that will turn on any actress at the drop of that hat.&quot;\r\nSee the day&apos;s top news photos.\r\nWhile rolling his eyes, Gubelmann continued that &quot;it&apos;s hard to remember&quot; why he chose Barton to star in his indie flick, &quot;because, you know, she&apos;s not here right now.  &quot;Now, I haven&apos;t spoken to her yet because she&apos;s totally unreachable, so I don&apos;t know exactly what happened. I mean, I&apos;m not as good at taking the high road a some people and yes, it would obviously be nice if she was here. Even just to hang out,&quot; he went on.\r\n\r\nGubelmann said Barton didn&apos;t seem &quot;at all&quot; unstable while shooting the flick in less than a month, 16 hours a day.  &quot;She did it and she did an amazing job. It&apos;s like, maybe she went method and maybe that&apos;s what happened!&quot; he said, laughing.  Producer Austin Stark was more sympathetic toward the actress, who required a police escort from her Hollywood Hills home to the hospital.\r\n\r\n&quot;I think we would have loved to have had her come out and support the movie, [but] you know, we wish her the best and obviously we hope she gets better,&quot; he told Us. &quot;Obviously, it&apos;s a trying time for her. I mean, obviously we&apos;d like her to be here but I don&apos;t think it hurts the movie.&quot;  Added producer Benji Kohn: &quot;She&apos;s going through a rough patch and she can&apos;t be here. And it&apos;s really too bad.&quot;  Director Morgan J. Freeman told Us: &quot;I hope Mischa is doing OK. My thoughts and prayers are with her. It&apos;s the actress&apos; third Emmy nod. She goes up against her costar in the TV movie, Jessica Lange.\nCheck out Drew&apos;s crazy hairstyles over the years.\n The drama earned 17 nominations, tying it for the most Emmy nominations ever for a TV movie.  Justin Timberlake was nominated for guest actor for Saturday Night Live. (He and Andy Samberg won an Emmy 2007 for &quot;D--- in a Box.&quot;)  Katherine Heigl -- who nearly died on the season finale of Grey&apos;s Anatomy -- was not nominated. The actress famously withdrew herself from 2008 consideration, saying she &quot;wasn&apos;t given the material&quot; necessary to warrant the honor.  Tina Fey&apos;s 30 Rock received a record-setting 22 nods, the most of any TV series in history.  Jennifer Aniston was nominated for her guest spot on the NBC comedy as well. (She only won one for Friends in 2002.)\nSee photos of Jennifer Aniston playing a stalker on 30 Rock.\n Family Guy was nominated as best comedy series -- making it the first animated show to score a nod in the category since The Flintstones in 1961.\nSee what stars look like as cartoons.\nNeil Patrick Harris hosts the 61st Annual Primetime Emmy Awards, airing Sept. 20 on CBS from L.A.&apos;s Jackson&apos;s will said.   \nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids through the years\nThe will, dated July 7, 2002, estimated his estate at that time at more than $500 million.\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nHis estate consisted almost entirely of &quot;non-cash, non-liquid assets, including primarily an interest in a catalogue of music royalty rights which is currently being administered by Sony ATV, and the interests of various entities,&quot; the 5-page document reads.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nHe also named his mother Katherine as guardian of his children -- Prince, 12, Paris, 11, and Blanket, 7.\n(The new Us Weekly reveals that their biological father is Arnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s L.A.-based dermatologist and Rowe&apos;s former boss.)\nIf Katherine died before him or couldn&apos;t serve as guardian, he nominated Diana Ross, according to the will.  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nJackson&apos;s will also states that he is not married and doesn&apos;t have any other children living or deceased.  Attorney John Branca, Barry Siegel and John McClain, a music executive, are named as executors.\nAfter the will was revealed, a Los Angeles judge granted Katherine Jackson limited authority over her son&apos;s estate until Monday. (The ruling came over the objections of Branca and McClain as co-executors of Jackson&apos;s estate.)\nShe was also granted &quot;slim&quot; authority to take control of the roughly 2,000 items from Neverland Ranch. (The items were set for auction earlier this year, but the sale was stopped after Jackson sued.)\nIn her filing, Katherine&apos;s attorneys said the memorabilia is being held by a former Jackson representative.  A court hearing is scheduled for Monday to discuss who should control Jackson&apos;s estate.", "isPartOf": {"@id": To me, invitations were just paper that contain important information, and upon first look, it usually gets thrown away. Well, my entire perception of invitations was thrown out the window when I walked into the&#xA0;Ceci New York studio. The walls didn&apos;t need any artwork, because they were filled with some of the most amazing invitations I had ever set eyes upon, including invitations for events hosted by&#xA0;Diddy, and&#xA0;Katherine Heigl&apos;s wedding. There were invitations that were on plexi-glass and wine bottles, and envelopes made of velvet and encrusted with jewels. Words could not do these invitations justice.\r\nWe had the pleasure of meeting Lisa Hoffman, who was so sweet and helpful. She wanted to create a very personal and meaningful invitation for us. When she told us she can do anything we wanted, she really meant it! There isn&apos;t anything that this woman cannot do. She ended up designing us a simple yet classy invitation that incorporated our color scheme consisting of warm fall colors, and even added personal touches, such as the laser cut pattern that is on my wedding dress! I cannot wait to start getting the beautiful metallic RSVP envelopes in my mailbox! These dream invitations really set the tone for our dream wedding!\r\nThe pattern on&#xA0;my Vera Wang wedding gown&#xA0;will be duplicated on the cinnamon brown invites (which cost $4,600). They&apos;ll also be addressed in hand hand calligraphy.\r\nFind out more about wedding invitations on WeddingChannel.com.\r\n&#xA0;", "isPartOf": {"@id":
