The girl was reportedly accompanied on the flight by a nanny, a child nurse and a third assistant.\nSee Madonna&apos;s past flings.\nA week ago, Malawi&apos;s highest court overturned an April lower court decision and ruled that Madonna could adopt Mercy, the second child she has adopted from the African country.  The previous ruling claimed she had not spent enough time in the country.\nThe high court, however, said the first judge had imposed too narrow a definition of residency, and lauded Madonna for her work with children in a poor country where half a million have lost a parent to AIDS.  \nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\nMercy should have reached London, where Madonna has a home, Saturday morning, the AP reports. https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/iproject-runwayi-2008-recap-fashion-that-drives-you-2008288/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/iproject-runwayi-2008-recap-fashion-that-drives-you-2008288/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/iproject-runwayi-2008-recap-fashion-that-drives-you-2008288/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Project Runway 2008 Recap: Fashion That Drives You", "datePublished": "2008-08-28T14:52:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:54:27-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The designers take a field trip to a parking garage to design using car parts on the August 27 episode", "articleBody": "Seat belts, carburetors and couture?   Season five has finally picked up its momentum, and this week&apos;s episode of Project Runway did not disappoint. To start off, the designers were told they were going on a field trip. After speculation of whom or what they would be designing for (Mariah Carey? A celebrity rooftop party?), they found themselves not at Mood Fabrics, but atop a parking garage. The challenge was to design an outfit using...car parts!\r\nTo start off the challenge, the designers had four minutes to rush over to a set of Saturn hybrids that were filled with car parts and accessories and grab as much material as they could. With no time to prepare beforehand, the designers had to grab what they could and hope for the best later.   After returning to Parsons, out came the hammers and gloves, but this time, the hammering and breaking was not done solely by Stella. Cuts and scrapes from the car parts ensued, causing Suede to go into his routine third-person diatribe. Keith became increasingly irritable and ended up snapping at his model for *gasp* sitting down to get her hair done at the TRESemme salon, which caused a rip in the skirt. Kenley&apos;s stress level went from high to maniacal when she learned that her model had to suddenly drop out of the competition, which topped off when she was already severely behind and had to re-work her design to fit the new model. Terri began to make fun of Korto&apos;s &quot;scarecrow&quot; but it turned out the joke was on her when Korto&apos;s design ended up amongst the top, and Terri got just a qualifying score to move on to the next challenge.    A surprise replacement for Nina Garcia&apos;s judging spot was Season 3 finalist Laura Bennett, and the celebrity guest judge for the week was stylist to the stars Rachel Zoe - who, ironically, has a show premiering shortly on Bravo. With that line-up, the panel was no doubt relentless on the designers when it came to runway time.   Blayne made a valiant effort to produce a garment with a different aesthetic. Unfortunately, the silhouette was misshaped and the final product fell flat. With fabrics like rubber and leather, one would think this would be &quot;Stella the Leatha&apos;s&quot; time to shine. Instead she took a chance at making something &quot;pretty&quot; with a skirt made of seatbelts and a top with a combination of fabrics that ended up missing the mark completely.  Jerrell really flexed his innovative muscles with a futuristic corset-like top and leather mini, but the big wow factor of the night was Leanne with her awesome cocktail dress with a twist of avant-garde that you wouldn&apos;t even know was made from car floorboards.     Kenley, Joe, Suede and Terri were safe for this round, and after a close run for number one between Korto, Leanne and Jerrell, Leanne prevailed as the top designer for the challenge.  Blayne made it safe but it seems his days are numbered. Stella didn&apos;t take a top spot as anticipated at the beginning of the challenge, but ended up in the bottom two and held on by a thread.  And Keith, after questioning himself and his design technique, ultimately failed and he was sent home.\r\nSeason five is moving along steadily, and we are finally getting a closer glimpse of who has the potential to make it to the final challenge.  The safety gloves from handling car parts are off, and the race gets tighter as we see who will end up being in, and who will be out.", "isPartOf": {"@id": In a suit obtained by TMZ.com, Richelle Olson, executive director of California&apos;s Desert Valley Charities, claims she was told Bruno was a celebrity who would appear and call numbers at the charity bingo game she ran for the elderly.  Bruno, she says in her legal papers, was an &quot;extreme, outrageous, offensive caricature of a gay man dressed in sexually revealing clothing with an Austrian accent...&quot;\nSee photos of more celebs acting silly\nShe claims he used &quot;vulgar and offensive language&quot; and a &quot;physical struggle ensued&quot; when she tried taking the microphone from him. According to her suit, Cohen also &quot;offensively touched, pushed and battered&quot; her, causing her to fall to the ground.  Three cameramen then rushed the stage ... &quot;where defendants attacked [her] for a period of one to five minutes to intentionally create a dramatic emotional response ... while [they] recorded her humiliation and embarrassment,&quot; the suit claims.\nSee photos of embarrassing celeb moments\nWhen the alleged assault ended, Olson went into another room where she was &quot;sobbing uncontrollably&quot; ... then was rendered unconscious ... &quot;falling forward onto the thinly covered concrete slab, passing out and causing her to hit her head,&quot; according to the suit.\nCan you spot Sacha Baron Cohen&apos;s wife in Us&apos; Baby Bump Hall of Fame gallery?\nOlson says she also was rushed to the hospital with a &quot;diagnosis of two brain bleeds&quot; -- and has since been confined to a wheelchair and walker.  Cohen and NBC Universal are among the parties she is suing for $25,000 in damages.  A rep for Cohen and NBC Universal has yet to comment. I started hanging with people in Hollywood. You can never say that someone forced you or got you into it, but as a result of hanging out, the door was opened on what ways there are to lose weight and not really have to work out.&quot;  She even told Us that she used Adderall, the same prescription drug -- usually given to people for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder -- that Us Weekly reported super-skinny Lindsay Lohan uses to stay thin.\r\nCheck out Lindsay Lohan&apos;s weight ups and downs through the years.\r\n&quot;Adderall ... I did abuse because it was fun,&quot; she said. &quot;If you take them as they are prescribed, I don&apos;t think there is a problem with them. They help people get healthy... The current bid for the item is $500, but most clothes are being valued at $200 to $300.\nSee photos of more generous celebrities. The big prize, however, is the chance to be the Hannah Montana star&apos;s roadie. It has received 35 bids since the auction began this past Thursday and is up to $6,600. The winner will also receive a backstage pass, a meet-and-greet with the singer and a personalized fan kit.   The eBay.com-partnered auction runs now until Thursday at 7 p.m. PST. "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "SPOILER ALERT: Click here to read who ends up being his fiancee", "articleBody": "The rose wasn&apos;t so sweet for Bachelor finalist Melissa Rycroft.\r\nAs Us reported in our March 9 issue, after Jason Mesnick gave the final rose (and the 3.1-carat engagement Neil Lane bling) to the former Dallas Cowboys cheerleader, 25, in the finale, he shocked audiences by breaking things off six weeks later in a taped After the Final Rose special to take another stab at his relationship with rejected finalist Molly Malaney, 24.\r\nSee photos of Molly and Melissa&apos;s time with Jason.\r\nAfter introducing both of the ladies to his family (and four-year-old son Ty) Mesnick received a shock of his own in the form of a surprise visit from former Bachelorette DeAnna Pappas who tells him she made a mistake when she rejected his proposal in favor of pro snowboarder Jesse Csincsak. Though she tells Mesnick. &quot;I could see myself having a relationship with you,&quot; he turns her down explaining that he&apos;s fallen hard for both Rycroft and Malaney.    At the final rose ceremony, Mesnick rejects a shocked Malaney who responds by telling him, &quot;I think you&apos;ve made a mistake, a big one.&quot;\r\nThe single dad then gets down on bended knee to propose to Rycroft, asking her to &quot;make me the happiest man&quot; by agreeing to marry him. The show cuts out with the happy couple jumping into the pool.\r\nCheck out which former Bachelor contestants are still with their final pick.\r\nHowever six weeks later, at the After the Final Rose special, a tearful Mesnick tells Bachelor host Chris Harrison that the &quot;chemistry is completely different&quot; with him and Rycroft and that he hasn&apos;t been able to stop thinking of Malaney. He then tells his blindsided (and angry) Rycroft, &quot;We&apos;re not right for each other.&quot; After breaking things off with his fiancee, Mesnick then asks Malaney for another shot, admitting that he&apos;s still in love with her. over the years.\nBesides Michael, the crypt is empty and marked only with a swooping letter  &quot;G.&quot;\nActress Sandra Dee, who died in 2005, is buried next door. "Chris Brown Gets Five Years Probation for Beating Rihanna", "datePublished": "2009-06-22T16:57:36-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:55:56-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The singer, who pleaded guilty to felony assault, will also spend 180 days doing community labor in Virginia", "articleBody": "Chris Brown pleaded guilty to one count of felony assault against Rihanna in a downtown Los Angeles Courtroom Monday.\nAs part of the plea bargain, the singer, 20, will receive five years probation and spend 180 days doing community labor in Virginia.\nBrown will also move home to Virginia, his lawyer, Mark Geragos, announced in court, but will return to  California once every three months for updates.\nDuring his probation, he must also obey a protective order, which means he cannot harm or harrass Rihanna, and a stay-away order, which requires him to stay at least 50 yards away from Rihanna at all times.  Rihanna did not have to testify.\nBrown arrived at the Clara Shortridge Foltz Criminal Justice Center at 1:30 PDT this afternoon for the hearing. He was escorted inside by eight uniformed officers and a bodyguard.   \nSee photos of stars in court\nBrown -- who donned a gray striped suit, brown shoes and striped tie --  appeared solemn, according to a witness. His mother followed behind him. The duo were both looking down.\nRihanna wore a black dress, sunglasses and pearls to the hearing, but was not in the courtroom when the judge handed down his decision to Brown.\nAfter Brown left the courtroom, Rihanna entered through a private entrance. She and her lawyer, Donald Etra, discussed the protective order with Judge Patricia Schnegg.\nBecause the two might appear at the same public events, the judge said that in those instances, the 50-yard stay away order would turn into a 10-yard order.\nIn addition, the judge said that the two-way order prevents Rihanna from contacting Brown at any point. Etra told the judge several times that such a stay-away order was not necessary, but Schnegg said she wanted to be cautious.\nLook back at Chris and Rihanna&apos;s happier days\nBrown turned himself into police in February for allegedly beating Rihanna. He was charged with two felonies.  He&apos;ll be formally sentenced Aug. 5.\nAfter the hearing, Geragos addressed the media outside the courthouse.    &quot;This is a kid who has never been in trouble before, who wants to move past this,&quot; his attorney said. &quot;He has accepted responsibility and will continue to do so. He embraces this as an opportunity to get his life back on track and his career back on track.&quot;\nGeragos said that although Brown wanted to thank his fans, he has restricted the singer from making a statement until after his official sentencing.\nRihanna&apos;s lawyer, Etra, also spoke to reporters and said that his client was &quot;feeling fine&quot; after the hearing.\n&quot;She was fully prepared to testify, and she would have told he truth about what happened that evening,&quot; he said.\nHe added that he and Rihanna -- who felt the protective order was sufficient but that the stay-away order was unnecessary -- would discuss a reduction in the latter.\nSchnegg said she would consider such a change only after the August sentencing.", "isPartOf": {"@id": I would never call myself a cutter. Girls go through different phases when they&#x2019;re growing up, when they&#x2019;re miserable and do different things, whether it&#x2019;s an eating disorder or they dabble in cutting.&quot;\r\nWatch Rolling Stone&apos;s behind-the-scenes cover shoot with Fox!\r\n(Interestingly, Angelina Jolie -- to whom Fox has been compared -- has admitted she used to cut herself as a teen.)Asked if she has ever had an eating disorder, Fox remained mum.\r\n\r\n&quot;If I did talk about it, I&#x2019;d be taking on a role-model status, and I&#x2019;d have to choose my words very carefully, and I&#x2019;d have to make sure I reveal it in a specific way, and I don&#x2019;t want to do it,&quot; she said.But the Tennesse native didn&apos;t hold back when talking about her low self-esteem.&quot;I&#x2019;m really insecure about everything,&quot; said Fox. &quot;I never think I&#x2019;m worthy of anything... I have a sick feeling of being mocked all the time. I have a lot of self-loathing.&quot;\r\n\r\nStill, she said, &quot;Self-loathing doesn&#x2019;t keep me from being happy. But that doesn&#x2019;t mean I don&#x2019;t struggle. I am very vulnerable. But I can be aggressive, hurtful, domineering and selfish, too. I&#x2019;m emotionally unpredictable and all over the place. I&#x2019;m a control freak.&quot;Fox said her temper &quot;is ridiculously bad. I&#x2019;ve destroyed the house. I go bats***.&quot;Just ask on-again beau Brian Austin Green.&quot;I&#x2019;ve had to say to Brian, &#x2018;You have to go and stop talking to me, because I&#x2019;m going to kill you. I&#x2019;m going to stab you with something. Please leave.&#x2019;&quot; Fox said. &quot;I&#x2019;d never own a gun for that reason. I wouldn&#x2019;t shoot to kill. Knight: Leaving Grey&#8217;s Anatomy Was the &#8220;Best Decision&#8221;", "datePublished": "2009-07-23T12:59:05-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:57:05-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "He says he left the medical drama because the creator was \"concerned\" about him coming out", "articleBody": "For T.R. Knight, leaving the hit medical drama Grey&apos;s Anatomy was the &quot;best decision&quot; he could have ever made.\r\nThe actor tells the latest issue Entertainment Weekly that he left the hit ABC show after executive producer Shonda Rhimes drastically cut his screen time this past season -- he appeared for only 48 minutes in the first nine episodes -- and showed concern over his decision to become openly gay.\r\nSee photos of hot TV doctors\r\n&quot;There just comes a time when it&apos;s so clear that moving on is the best decision,&quot; Knight tells EW (on newsstands Friday).\r\nKnight, who had played series regular Dr. George O&apos;Malley for all five seasons, also says there was a &quot;breakdown in communication&quot; with Rhimes.\r\nAlthough Rhimes has said she purposefully cut Knight&apos;s character from recent episodes so his disappearance in the May finale -- in which he appeared to have died after he was struck by a bus -- wouldn&apos;t have been noticeable to audiences, the star says it wasn&apos;t justified.\r\nSee photos of the cozy couples of Grey&apos;s Anatomy\r\n&quot;It didn&apos;t seem like an ebb to me,&quot; he says. &quot;No other series regular&apos;s character had ever disappeared like mine did this past season.&quot;\r\nHe also felt he didn&apos;t understand his character, especially when he slept with his best friend Izzie (played by Katherine Heigl) while he was married.   &quot;My five-year experience proved to me that I could not trust any answer that was given [about George],&quot; he says.\r\nSee more TV stars who are undergoing big changes!\r\nKnight also cites the dismissal of former costar Isaiah Washington, who used an anti-gay slur on set. It took Rhimes three months to publicly condemn Washington, which Knight calls &quot;frustrating.&quot;\r\nThe incident brought about another problem for Knight. He says complications arose between him and Rhimes when he decided to respond to the situation by coming out publicly.\r\n&quot;I think she was concerned about having my statement come out so close to the [initial] event,&quot; he says, adding that she was among those who encouraged him to stay in the closet.\r\nAlthough he got out of his $14 million contract three years early, he has no regrets.   &quot;There are a lot of people who would like to be in my position,&quot; he says. &quot;But in the end, I need to be fulfilled in my work -- that&apos;s more important than the money.&quot;\r\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories\r\nKnight, who was asked to appear on the show&apos;s sixth season in flashbacks but refused, is currently working on theater projects.\r\nIn September, he&apos;ll headline a stage production of Parade in L.A. and will debut on Broadway in the Stanley Tucci-directed revival of Lend Me a Tenor in February.\r\nDespite speculation that Heigl would leave the show with her off-screen pal, she recently began filming the show&apos;s next season.\r\n&quot;It&apos;s a little bizarre,&quot; she told Usmagazine.com about working without Knight. &quot;I had to call him this morning and say, &apos;OK, so this is what happened yesterday! after he&apos;d taken a dangerous combination of drugs.\n&quot;He always mixed so much of it,&quot; Rwaramba, 42, is quoted as saying. &quot;There was one period that it was so bad that I didn&apos;t let the children see him. He always ate too little and mixed too much.&quot;   \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nDistraught over Jackson&apos;s drug use, she once proposed an intervention, contacting his mother Katherine and sister Janet for help, only to find herself fired by the King of Pop.  &quot;He didn&apos;t want to listen; that was one of the times he let me go,&quot; says Rwaramba, who started out as an office assistant.\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nRwaramba, who was last fired in December, also sheds light on Jackson&apos;s debt (he was reportedly awash in about $400 million in debt at the time of his death).  Last April, when she visited Jackson&apos;s children -- Prince, now 12; Paris, 11; and Blanket, 7 -- she had to buy balloons for Paris&apos; birthday because the singer was so broke.\nSays Rwaramba, &quot;Michael had no idea about money.&quot;  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\nOn Friday, the day after Jackson died, Rwaramba  says the singer&apos;s mother Katherine called her from Michael&apos;s rented L.A. house and asked where he kept his money. &quot;She said, &apos;Grace, the children are crying. They are asking about you. They can&apos;t believe that their father died. Grace, you remember Michael used to hide cash at the house. I am here. Where can it be?&apos;&quot;\nShe told Katherine to look &quot;at the garbage bags and under the carpets,&quot; Rwaramba recalls. &quot;She said, &apos;Grace, where are you? Come. I will pick you up from the airport.&apos; She sounded so strong. the supermodel says in the July issue of Ladies&apos; Home Journal (on newsstands June 9).\r\n&quot;With what I know, I don&apos;t see why anyone would get married.&quot;\r\n\r\nBrinkley -- who divorced Peter Cook in July 2008 after he had an affair with his teenage assistant -- has decided that after four failed marriages, she is done with the institution.  &quot;I totally believe in true love, and I think couples should celebrate their love over and over again,&quot; she says, &quot;[but] right at the beginning of a relationship, I would formalize an exit strategy.&quot;  If she could do it over again, she wishes the custody trial -- Brinkley retained sole custody of her two kids and the 18 Hamptons properties that were disputed -- wasn&apos;t so public.\r\n\r\n&quot;I feel like I should apologize to everybody for them having to read all that tawdry stuff, and having it delivered to their kitchen tables when their kids are around, you know?&quot; Brinkley, 55, says.  Still, despite accusations, she didn&apos;t keep the trial open by choice.  &quot;Divorce courts in New York are always open to the public,&quot; she says. &quot;I didn&apos;t want special treatment.&quot;  Although she and Cook ended on bad terms, she found solace with her second ex-husband, Billy Joel, who is godfather to her son Jack, 13, and daughter Sailor, 10.\r\n\r\n &quot;There have been times when I have had to spend time with lawyers or whatever and he&apos;s babysat,&quot; she tells Ladies&apos; Home Journal. &quot;He lives nearby, so he&apos;s like, &apos;Sen &apos;em over here!&apos;&quot;  Although she remains close with Joel, she has no new man in her life.  &quot;I haven&apos;t always followed my own advice, but I&apos;ve always believed that you&apos;ve got to be whole before starting with someone new,&quot; she says. &quot;You&apos;ve got to find that inner peace. With Usher", "datePublished": "2009-07-23T19:07:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T20:59:44-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The singer's wife was \"blind-sided\" by the divorce, her best friend tells Us", "articleBody": "More than a month after Usher filed for divorce from his wife of nearly two years, Tameka Foster Raymond, her best friend tells Usmagazine.com exclusively what did -- and didn&apos;t -- cause their marriage to end.\r\n\r\n&quot;It&apos;s very, very challenging to have a relationship ... that&apos;s sort of &apos;normal,&apos; but the existence that they had was far from normal and there was just a lot of scrutiny and a lack of support for their marriage for some reason,&quot; Nyeisha Dewitt tells Us. &quot;I don&apos;t know what role that played in it, but I just know that it&apos;s very difficult sometimes when you are in that situation to overlook some of the insanity that&apos;s going on outside of the relationship and the pressure that it imposes within the relationship.&quot;\r\nStill, rumors circulated that Foster, a stylist, married the Grammy-winning artist for his money.  &quot;To say that she&apos;s a gold-digger ... that&apos;s just not the case,&quot; her best friend says. &quot;That just totally discredits her as a professional, as an entrepreneur, as a creative thinker, and it just totally destroys anything that she took her money and time to build.&quot;\r\n\r\nUsher, 30, and Foster, 38, have two sons together -- Usher Raymond V, 21 months, and Naviyd Ely, who was born last December. Foster also has three sons from a previous relationship.\r\n&quot;People say that she just had a baby so that she could get paid,&quot; Dewitt tells Us. &quot;Why can&apos;t you just be a regular person who has a wonderful job, a great career, who&apos;s well respected for the work that they do, and be happy with that and then just fall in love with someone? Then you turn into a gold-digger? How does that happen?&quot;\r\nDewitt also dispels reports that Usher is actually gay.   &quot;No way -- I believe unequivocally that he is a straight man,&quot; she tells Us. &quot;That&apos;s never been an issue.&quot;  \r\n\r\nShe also says the fact that Usher was eight years her junior was overplayed in the media.  &quot;A lot of people marry guys that are younger, or a lot of men marry women that are much younger, but it doesn&apos;t seem to have the same range of hostility toward it,&quot; she says.\r\nIn fact, when the couple was first married in August 2007, Dewitt says they were truly in love.  &quot;They just seemed to really complement one another in that way and bring out one another&apos;s strengths and balance each other out.&quot;\r\nAnd what about reports that Usher&apos;s mother, Jonetta Patton, disapproved of Foster and was against their wedding?  \r\n\r\n&quot;I have never personally witnessed any hard feelings,&quot; she says. &quot;I can&apos;t say for sure whether his mom is involved in any way. I know that she is a grandmother, and that&apos;s good. That&apos;s good to have in your life, in your children&apos;s lives.&quot;\r\nWhen Usher filed for divorce on June 12, Dewitt says Foster was &quot;blind-sided.&quot;\r\n&quot;They had experienced some challenges from March, but she was definitely thinking that they were working through it,&quot; she tells Us. &quot;I don&apos;t believe that she felt that a divorce was eminent. She was not informed that divorce papers had been filed. She found out probably just like everyone else did.&quot;\r\nNow, she says Foster is focusing on her work and her children.   Dewitt, who says she loves Usher, believes the two will remain friends.   &quot;I really think that they can be friends,&quot; she says.\r\n&quot;The essence of their relationship is friendship, and hopefully they can maintain that. That&apos;s what it&apos;s all about. They are parents. Both of them are wonderful parents, and they both love their children... I hope and pray that they can really recover their friendship after all is said and done.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": On Tuesday, pageant owner Donald Trump announced Prejean would keep her crown despite failing to reveal she had posed in her underwear as a teenager.  (Prejean said the pictures were leaked to humiliate her because of her anti-gay marriage views, calling it a &quot;vicious and mean-spirited&quot; attacks. Since we&apos;re whipping up a wedding to suit the stars, Us Weekly asked me to share my some tips for planning a platinum affair on a, well, &quot;2009&quot; budget:\r\nParty on a Tuesday! (Or any day but Saturday)\r\n&#xA0;Hey, aren&apos;t the Oscars on a Sunday night? The stars are decked out seven days a week. Make like a celeb and host your affair on ANY DAY but Saturday night. Even better, plan quickly like Van and Eric who picked a Sunday two months out, and you might grab a date that&apos;s still open. Save big bucks on the venue&#x2014;and other vendors, too.\r\nFind more affordable wedding ideas\r\n&quot;Luxe/Less&quot; Your Look\r\nNow, we&apos;re not saying you should wear a Gap tank with an Armani silk ballgown skirt &#x2026; but why not? When it comes to looking like the glam goddesses of Hollywood, pick your priorities. There&apos;s no rule that says you have to pair your $5,000 gown with Jimmy Choo shoes. Splurge on the gown, and hit the mall like my client Lisa Loeb did (who found Charles Jourdan jeweled shoes off-the-rack). Stop by Payless, which now carries designer shoes by celebrity style maven Lela Rose &#xA0;(who&apos;s doing Van&apos;s bridesmaid dresses and shoes). They&apos;re just $44.99! (You can browse wedding day fashion by budget at Weddingchannel.com/gowns).\r\nTap Your Inner Foodie\r\nWhat, Wolfgang Puck &quot;not available&quot; to cater your big day? Not to fret. Chefs from Tampa to Tacoma are all turning up the heat on fun, personalized wedding day food. Go casual-chic like Sandra Bullock and Jesse James, who served up Southern BBQ picnic style, or Julia Roberts and husband Danny Moder, who celebrated their Fourth of July wedding with hot dogs, lemon chicken and corn on the cob. For dessert, Rebecca Romijn and Jerry O&apos;Connell offered mini-country apple and red velvet cupcakes. We&apos;re so excited that Chef Xavier Deshayes of The Ronald Reagan Building &#xA0;is going to deliver Van &amp; Eric&apos;s signature &quot;Trackerita&quot; paired with mini Pork Tenderloin Sandwiches at cocktail hour as an ode to their annual Indy 500 trip. &#xA0;\r\n\r\n&#xA0;", "isPartOf": {"@id": Her third book, Love Is in the Mix: Making Meals into Memories, is due to hit stores Oct. 13, 2009, according to Amazon.com.\nSee Jon and Kate Gosselin through the years.\nThe Jon &amp; Kate Plus 8 star is already the author of Multiple Bles8ings: Surviving to Thriving with Twins and Sextuplets and the recently released Eight Little Faces, for which she has recently traveled the nation to promote.  &quot;Fans ... won&apos;t want to miss this inside look at one of America&apos;s most famous close-knit families,&quot; the back cover states.\nSee photos of reality love gone bad.\nIn addition to offering nutritious recipes and tips on eating organically, Love Is in the Mix promises to teach readers &quot;how to craft family traditions that create happy memories&quot; and &quot;how to feed a large family on a budget.&quot; The book will include family photos and anecdotes about her twins and sextuplets.  According to the site, Kate will also offer insight into handling picky eaters, making lunchtime fun, planning meals for vacations, and making ordinary days &quot;extra special.&quot;\nSee what your favorite stars look like with Kate Gosselin&apos;s hairdo.\n Although excerpts from the book have not yet been released, commenters have already begun slamming the star&apos;s previously released recipes and claim she stole them &quot;from product boxes and magazine articles.&quot;  One person wrote that her recipe for the cereal treat Monkey Munch -- which was mentioned on the TLC show -- is the same as one on the Chex brand website and calls it &quot;plagiarism.&quot;\nSee photos of Jon Gosselin and his mistress.\nOther commenters were shocked that the woman who once said that &quot;real cooks don&apos;t need recipes&quot; was qualified to write a cookbook. They wrote on Amazon.com that on the show, Kate does little to &quot;no cooking, no meals, just snacks -- crackers, yogurt, grapes, cukes and peppers in pita. The woman can&apos;t cook.&quot;  Still, with Kate&apos;s previous two books reaching the New York Times Best Seller list, the book&apos;s publishers are likely expecting similar success with Love Is in the Mix. In addition to her income from book sales, the newest issue of Us Weekly, on newsstands today, reports that the Gosselins -- who live in a $1.1 million house -- earn approximately $50,000 to $75,000 https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/recessionista-markdown-madness-2009246/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/recessionista-markdown-madness-2009246/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/stylish/news/recessionista-markdown-madness-2009246/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Recessionista: Markdown Madness", "datePublished": "2009-06-24T09:48:04-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:00-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Bergdorf Goodman is slashing prices on chic seasonal wardrobe staples 50-60% starting this week", "articleBody": "Here it comes! Department stores give birth to complete insanity.  My insider guy at Bergdorf&apos;s, Eddie, informed me that BG will mark down Spring and Summer merchandise to 50% this Thursday. I can hardly contain myself. And I&apos;m not the only one! Women go bananas when there&apos;s a sale, especially on items with big ticket names: YSL, Alaia, Chanel, Manolo, DVF, Stella McCartney, Kors. I have learned that entering a sale this low may cause mental and physical harm to you.\r\nCheck out my tips for successful shopping:\r\n1. Do not drink coffee before a sale. For two reasons: 1) you will be hyped up on caffeine and not think clearly. 2) you will need to go to restroom which is not on the same floor - which means you may/ miss out on that one Valentino floral applique bag.\r\n2. Wear an anorak or some lightweight coat with deep pockets: not because you&apos;re shoplifting, but because you will ditch that suitcase of an &quot;it&quot; bag and keep all your necessities in those deep pockets.\r\n3. Bring a phone to post your finds on Facebook or email a photo to friends to get quick opinions on whether you need yet another Louboutin slingback with a cork platform or a Tory tunic in a color you&apos;ve never seen before.\r\n4. Wear a little black dress, slip or tank - something that will work with all of these sale items: shoes, bags, jackets, etc.\r\n5. Maintain your sanity. There will be bitchy salespeople as well as the bitchiest customers you&apos;ve ever seen. You may also need a translator for all the different New York dialects spoken/spewed at you.\r\nCheck out which celebrities are bargain shoppers too!\r\n6.  Read, ask about, and do not assume the return policy. You may want to know how to get out of something when your husband demands why this is the 60th BG bag in the house this week. BAG TIP: you can always schlep over to Jam paper products [(212) 473-6666] and get those brown paper bags with no name printed on them and switch bags around before you get into the house.\r\n7. There is always, always, always a way to get what you want if you want it that badly. Make friends not enemies with a salesperson and ask them to grab a particular shoe in your size on your behalf, give them your credit card number and instruct them to charge away. Sometimes the hot products end up on hold with no takers and you can breathe once again when that item is in your hot hands. Also, my requests sometimes seem futile, yet suddenly the YSL patent leather, shortie sold out bootie miraculously appears...in my size!\r\n8. If anyone asks: &quot;which color do you wear more often?&quot; &quot;Red goes with everything&quot; &quot;what would you wear more of..?&quot; Slap them! It&quot;s not about that! Or anything that sounds like that? Another slap!\r\n9. Keep your purchases close. I once dropped a left shoe to try on another on-sale left shoe and almost got a back spasm chasing after a rather over zealous customer who took my Miu Miu ballerina thinking it was up for grabs.\r\n10. Have fun! Happy shopping...and listen up, doll: If you think your ass looks fat in that - it probably is, you answered your own question.", "isPartOf": {"@id": her tune &quot;Already Gone&quot; because it sounded similar to Beyonce&apos;s song, &quot;Halo.&quot;  Now Tedder -- who co-wrote both tracks -- is firing back.\r\nSee American Idols&apos; weight ups and downs.\r\n&quot;&apos;Already Gone&apos; is one of the best songs I&apos;ve written or produced since &apos;Bleeding Love,&apos; and stands on its own merits apart from &apos;Halo,&apos;&quot; Tedder tells Usmagazine.com in a statement.\r\n&quot;They are two entirely different songs conceptually, melodically and lyrically, and I would never try to dupe an artist such as Kelly Clarkson or Beyonce into recording over the same musical track,&quot; he continues. &quot;The idea is both hurtful and absurd.\r\nSee before and after photos of Kelly Clarkson and other stars&apos; makeovers.\r\n&quot;I think when people hear &apos;Already Gone,&apos; they will hear what I hear: one of the greatest female vocalists on earth giving her most haunting and heart-breaking performance on a song she helped write,&quot; he goes on.\r\nTedder adds: &quot;I challenge people to listen and form their own opinions.&quot;\r\nOver the weekend, an outraged Clarkson told Canada&apos;s CBC radio network she &quot;fought and fought&quot; with her record label to stop the release of the song.\r\nLook back at Beyonce&apos;s fashion hits and misses over the years.\r\n&quot;No one&apos;s gonna be sittin&apos; at home, thinking &apos;Man, Ryan Tedder gave Beyonce and Kelly the same track to write to,&apos;&quot; she recalled saying. &quot;No, they&apos;re just gonna be saying I ripped someone off.\r\n&quot;In the end, they&apos;re releasing it without my consent,&quot; said Clarkson, who performed the tune two weeks ago on The Late Show With David Letterman. &quot;It sucks, but it&apos;s one of those things I have no control over. I already made my album. At this point, the record company can do whatever they want with it.&quot;\r\nSee pics of Clarkson and other stars at Disney World.\r\nThis isn&apos;t the first time the American Idol champ has clashed with collaborators.\r\nIn 2007, she faced off against RCA honcho Clive Davis over the release of her third album My December. He said the album lacked radio hits; she disagreed and aired her frustrations to the press. (&quot;I am not a fan [of Davis],&quot; she icily told USA Weekend.)\r\nIn the end, Clarkson apologized to &quot;those whom I have done disservice&quot; after the release of the album (which failed to Magician Recalls Michael Jackson&#8217;s Final Hours", "datePublished": "2009-06-26T18:10:08-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:12-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Ed Alonzo tells Us the singer \"was stunning to watch\" but complained of laryngitis at rehearsals Wednesday", "articleBody": "The day before Michael Jackson suffered a cardiac arrest and died, the King of Pop seemed completely fine, a magician working on his upcoming tour tells Usmagazine.com exclusively.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nEd Alonzo -- who also worked as a concert magician on Britney Spear&apos;s Circus tour -- was hired by the late singer to help design some of the magical illusions for Jackson&apos;s London shows.\n&quot;Michael was on stage performing the numbers, singing and dancing with the cast,&quot; Alonzo told Us about seeing Jackson Wednesday evening at rehearsals. &quot;It was a privilege to be able to watch the concert that no one will see now.&quot;\nHe said Jackson -- wearing a white shirt and pants -- arrived at the Staples Center in L.A. around 6:30 p.m.\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\n&quot;By the time that Michael came in, all we had to do was just show [the plan] to him. He was such a quick learner,&quot; he said. &quot;He would learn this stuff in seconds. And jump right into it! The choreography, all of it... He looked fantastic.&quot;\nWhen it was time to sing, Alonzo said Jackson mentioned a seemingly minor ailment.\n&quot;He claimed that he felt he had a little bit of laryngitis. He said &apos;I&apos;m not going to sing this full-out because I have this laryngitis.&apos; But he looked great and these pop-locking moves that he was doing on stage with the crew were just breathtaking... He didn&apos;t seem tired. He went from one move to the next. It was an unbelievable experience to be with him and to see it all come together.&quot;\nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\nMentally, Jackson seemed completely fine.\n&quot;He was joking with the crew on stage,&quot; he said. &quot;There was a cameraman on stage ... that was a foot away from him that was kind of crouched down and Michael said some kind of funny gesture like, &apos;Oh you&apos;re very close, look how close you are.&apos; And he reached down and touched the cameraman on the top of the head in a joking manner. You could see on the screen how big Michael&apos;s image was on these projection screens. He was playful and light-hearted.&quot;\nAlonzo spent the rest of the evening watching him perform.\n&quot;I just thought, &apos;Wow, he still has it,&apos;&quot; he told Us. &quot;When he did &apos;Thriller,&apos; I was just in awe. I stayed for a while, probably until about midnight. And then they started to rehearse the &apos;Thriller&apos; number with a gigantic spider on stage and I thought, &apos;Well, it&apos;s getting late...&apos; Had I known, I would have stayed another half hour and watched more.&quot;\nHe said that Jackson, who appeared to weigh only 120 pounds despite his over-6-foot-tall frame, rehearsed with the dancers until 1 a.m.\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories\nAt rehearsals the following day, none of the crew knew anything was wrong until media reports began circulating the following afternoon.\n&quot;I wasn&apos;t sure what was happening,&quot; he said. &quot;People were just looking at their phones and looking at websites and texts that they were getting. I think the news was now coming out. [Show producer Kenny] Ortega was on and off the phone probably five or six different times. And the news was slowly coming in, but it was not definitive. And Kenny finally looked at us and said, &apos;We need to call a group meeting.&apos;&quot;\nAlonzo added: &quot;He said, &apos;Michael Jackson was taken to the hospital. We&apos;re not sure at this point what has happened, but Michael Jackson has passed away.&apos; And then there was just this gasp. It was the words we didn&apos;t want to hear.&quot;\nWith the collected group of dancers and crew members in shock, Alonzo said Ortega got choked up as he told them all that they would &quot;wrap for now.&quot;\n&quot;He said, &apos;Michael said he worked with the greatest artists on this event,&apos;&quot; Alonzo told Us. &quot;It was really sad.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "\"They spoke for the first time in 23 years,\" a source tells Us of their emotional conversation", "articleBody": "\r\n\r\nBefore Farrah Fawcett died of cancer, the star reconnected with her ex-husband, Lee Majors, after more than two decades of silence, a source tells Usmagazine.com.\r\n\r\nTake a look back at the life of Farrah Fawcett\r\n\r\n\"When Farrah got diagnosed, and it became public, Lee started calling Farrah's close friends to get updates on her,\" a source tells Us. \"He did that for two and a half years. He just wanted to know how she was doing because he still cared about her as a friend.\"\r\n\r\nThe Charlie's Angels star wed the Six Million Dollar Man star in 1973, and although they were married for nine years, they were separated in 1979. When Fawcett was first diagnosed with anal cancer in 2006, Majors tried to contact her indirectly.\r\n\r\nRemember those stars who died last year\r\n\r\n\"He didn't feel like he could reach out to her himself -- it had just been too long, but he still cared about her deeply,\" the source tells Us. \"He would send funny messages to her through friends, and she would do the same, and it was very sweet.\"\r\n\r\nAfter the star's cancer came back, it had been 23 years since she and Majors had spoken.\r\n\r\nSee photos of today's top news stories\r\n\r\n\"This past February, her birthday, he decided to call her for the first time. They spoke for the first time in 23 years,\" the source tells Us. \"They had a 40-minute phone conversation about her life, and the cancer and it was such a lovely moment for the two of them. I guess it was a very good conversation. They joked, and they got a little bit emotional.\"\r\n\r\nThe source adds: \"I think it was good given the current situation [for] closure, otherwise they never would've spoken again. I think he always wanted to talk to her again, but he was just afraid to speak to her before.\"\r\n\r\nAlthough Fawcett never married again after her divorce from Majors, she had been dating longtime boyfriend Ryan O'Neal for nearly 30 years.\r\n\r\nO'Neal proposed to her countless times, but she always said no until last week when she agreed to marry him. She died a few days later on Thursday.\r\n\r\nSee Us' photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\r\n\r\nThe source tells Us that although they had each moved on, their brief reunion meant a lot to both of them. \"[Majors] has a wonderful wife now, of course,\" the source says, \"but Farrah will always be very special to him.\"", "isPartOf": {"@id": Under the deal, Seacrest will be exclusive to CKX in broadcast TV primetime to host Idol or any CKX-produced show that might succeed it. The deal had been in the works for the past several weeks.  With his new pact, Seacrest now more than triples his previous salary of slightly less than $5 million per season.\r\nCheck out Ryan&apos;s on-screen style.\r\nSeacrest will still maintain a cable agreement with Comcast and his gig as E! Entertainment&apos;s main anchor. He has said he may leave the show when his contract is up at the end of next season. The singer&apos;s death was palpable across the world. Hundreds left scrap books, flowers and candles outside his childhood home in Gary, Ind.\nOutside the UCLA Medical Center after Jackson&apos;s passing, hundreds began chanting, &quot;Michael! Michael!&quot; as another fan blasted &quot;Man in the Mirror&quot; from an iPod dock.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\n&quot;He was the first concert I ever went to! It was my birthday present when I was 6-years old,&quot; Missy Traubhill, 29, told Usmagazine.com. &quot;My mom took me and my cousin in a limo, and we went to go see Thriller. I bought a blue muscle T-shirt with him on the front. He was in his little black pants, his skinny little black pants and white socks and black shoes. It was my best birthday memory of my life.&quot;\nDionica Bel, 25, recalled that Jackson&apos;s HIStory was her first album.  &quot;I wanted to dance like him, to sing like him,&quot; she said. &quot;I, to this day, have not stopped trying to moonwalk. He will always be one of the premiere reasons I fell in love with the kind of music I listen to today. He is his own genre. There would be no Justin Timberlake, there would be no Usher, there would be none of those pop artists today, if not for the ground work that Michael Jackson laid out for them.&quot;  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\nOutside NYC&apos;s Apollo Theater late Thursday, fans remembered Jackson as well.  &quot;What really touched everybody so much out here is knowing that we lost a great person,&quot; Conway Murray, 39, told Us. &quot;It&apos;s sad, but it&apos;s a great moment to see everybody out here together as one, to share the legacy of Michael Jackson.&quot;\nWearing a bright yellow Michael Jackson T-shirt featuring four printed pictures of the singer&apos;s face, Latifa Salaam, 54, told Us she was &quot;horrified&quot; when she heard the news of his passing.  &quot;I jumped up. I said, &apos;No!&apos; But it was true,&quot; she said. &quot;So I grabbed the phone and called my daughter, everybody. Everybody heard. I called my sister, called my cousin. They were crying on the phone.&quot;\nAdded Jasmine Watson, 19: &quot;I came out here because I heard the commotion and wanted to be a part of the memorial. It&apos;s beautiful. Here we get to see everyone come together and be together to remember him. I don&apos;t think there will ever be another King of Pop.&quot;  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\nIn NYC&apos;s Times Square, a crowd gathered on Broadway and 44th Street outside the MTV studios. An ABC News banner read, &quot;Michael Jackson, King of Pop, Dead at 50.&quot;  At one point, a bus drove down Seventh Avenue blasting &quot;Billie Jean.&quot; Crowds cheered.\nStephanie Defeo, 34, told Us: &quot;I&apos;m heartbroken. You can say Michael Jackson anywhere in the world and people will understand. I can&apos;t believe he&apos;s dead. But critics said even Jackman -- who opened the show with a musical tribute spoofing this year&apos;s best picture nominees -- couldn&apos;t save the dull, overformatted awards show. (A preliminary measurement of the nation&apos;s biggest markets shows ratings for this year&apos;s Academy Awards went up 6 percent over last year.)\r\n\r\nNew York&apos;s Daily News praised his energy but added that making the three-hour ceremony seem lively &quot;would have required powers beyond those of Wolverine.&quot;  &quot;Jackman did his best. His mission just wasn&apos;t accomplishable,&quot; said the critic, who also didn&apos;t care for Jackman&apos;s &quot;human excrement&quot; joke in his showcase opener.\r\n\r\nThe New York Post&apos;s Linda Stasi said Jackman &quot;performed like a cheesy cruise-ship entertainer to the endless hours of awards to dull men we&apos;ve never heard of for categories we don&apos;t care about.&quot;  Though Jackman was &quot;charming,&quot; a Newsweek critic writes that &quot;the material didn&apos;t live up to his talents as a host.&quot; The critic added that the &quot;the big Beyonce number really did seem to be stolen from American Idol.&quot;\r\n\r\nThe Los Angeles Times didn&apos;t care for Jackman&apos;s &quot;chorus boy spaz-out&quot; and noted that when he sat on nominee Frank Langella&apos;s lap, it was &quot;weird.&quot;\r\n\r\nThe Associated Press also said Jackman couldn&apos;t save the show:  &quot;He&apos;s only human. And he&apos;s only one man.  &quot;Along with Jackman presiding, this year&apos;s Oscarcast was supposed to feel stylistically new and invigorated.  &quot;In a year when Oscar winners seemed more predictable than usual, the night&apos;s suspense for many viewers had been diverted to wondering whether the broadcast itself would successfully deliver a few welcome surprises.  &quot;But what passed for surprises was an overformatted style that seemed to turn the night into a Learning Annex short course in how movies are made.&quot;\r\nTell Us: Did you think Hugh did a good job?", However, according to Reuters, some are questioning whether it&apos;s right to celebrate a model who was the subject of last year&apos;s biggest cocaine scandal. In September, 2005, photographs of the 32-year-old model allegedly snorting cocaine appeared on the front page of The Daily Mirror.   &#xA0; Though the model was never charged over the allegations, critics and drug charities are wondering what kind of message the award is sending to aspiring fashionistas. &quot;I think it&apos;s a bad reflection on the world of fashion,&quot; said Jane Ennis, editor of the British celebrity magazine Now. &quot;The fact that she has become an even bigger icon since getting into all this trouble is fantastically decadent. Sometimes commercial interests should be set aside to look at the wider picture.&quot; George Ruston, director of Hope UK, a drug education charity in Britain, pronounced the award &quot;unhelpful&quot; and said that advertisers were as much to blame as Moss. &#xA0; But he added that for every young person who looks up to Moss as a role model, many do not, and the problems of alcohol, tobacco and cannabis abuse are worse than that of cocaine. &#xA0; &quot;She&apos;s become a bigger name since the scandal and anyone who affiliates himself with her name will reap the publicity,&quot; aid Bryan Roberts, analyst at London trend spotting agency Planet Retail. &#xA0; Moss was originally dropped from campaigns by H&amp;M, Chanel and Burberry, but made a surprise comeback that has her featured in at least 18 major campaigns this season, including Louis Vuitton, Virgin Mobile, and Calvin Klein. Besides starring in films like The Family Stone and Failure to Launch, she's created a fashion collection called Bitten for the reasonably priced chain Steve &amp; Barry and even played&hellip;", "articleBody": "Actress Sarah Jessica Parker hasn&apos;t just been resting in her Manolo Blahniks during the three years since Sex and the City went off the air.\r\nBesides starring in films like The Family Stone and Failure to Launch, she&apos;s created a fashion collection called Bitten for the reasonably priced chain Steve &amp; Barry and even played fashion editor for the July issue of O magazine.\r\nParker, 42, stopped by the Today show on Friday to chat about her latest project with Matt Lauer.\r\nHaving grown up in a family that was on a tight budget, the actress explains that it was important to her that every item in the line be priced under $20.\r\n&quot;I mean, I grew up with not a whole lot of access to things that were costly,&quot; says Parker. &quot;I come from a family where my mother had to be very intrepid and industrious about things. So I&apos;m keenly aware of things not being accessible to people, especially to women and especially when it comes to fashion.&quot;\r\nDiversity was also at the forefront of Parker&apos;s mind while she was designing her collection.\r\n&quot;What appealed to me about this is the idea of making fashion accessible to all women in this country despite their economic status, their age, their size, their ethnic background, their shape, their anything. And I think it&apos;s sort of just democratization of fashion that I really love.&quot;\r\nIn an interview with Entertainment Tonight, Parker, whose designs have been criticized for being too &quot;junior&apos;s section,&quot; admits that the line isn&apos;t necessarily a reflection of her personal style.\r\n&quot;There&apos;s a lot of stuff from this line that other women will wear better then me, that actually suits them better. That&apos;s the thing about fashion, you can&apos;t just do what you want to wear. You have to think about other sizes, shapes and colors of women.&quot;\r\nMeanwhile, the second round of negotiations for a Sex and the City movie continues apace.     After the hit HBO series took its final bow in 2004, there was discussion of a movie, but negotiations ended, reportedly because of feuding between Kim Cattrall and the rest of the cast, which includes Kristin Davis and Cynthia Nixon.\r\n&quot;I feel more hopeful this time, but there still remains so much stuff, simple, logistical things to be done and hammered out,&quot; Parker told Lauer.\r\nParker reiterated to ET that talks have been hitting some snags, but not due to strife among cast members.\r\n&quot;This is a very complicated puzzle to put back - not for reason that people speculate about because as far as I know all of the actresses want to be together again for this movie.&quot;    She added, &quot;It&apos;s a wonderful idea to ponder and I&apos;m not being cagey but it&apos;s a complicated affair to get that show up and running for a finite period of time.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": Stuart Backerman tells Us. &quot;He knew his kids would enjoy it.&quot;  \nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids\n&quot;He wanted his kids to see him perform at least once to get the vibe of the Michael Jackson mania,&quot; says Backerman of Jackson, who hadn&apos;t hit the stage since a series of 2001 tribute concerts in NYC.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nJackson --&#xA0; who died at age 50 after suffering cardiac arrest June 25 -- named his mother Katherine as guardian of his three children -- Prince, 12, Paris, 11, and Blanket, 7 and &quot;intentionally&quot; omitted Debbie Rowe, the children&apos;s biological mother, from his will.\n(The new Us Weekly breaks the news that the children&apos;s biological father is Arnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s L.A.-based dermatologist and Rowe&apos;s former boss.)\nIf Katherine died before him or couldn&apos;t serve as guardian, Jackson nominated Diana Ross, according to his will.  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed through the years\nDespite their father&apos;s passing, Jackson&apos;s kids &quot;are happy,&quot; Jackson patriarch Joe said at a press conference Monday, adding that they&apos;re with &quot;other young ones in the Jackson family.... a Los Angeles police spokesperson tells Us. &quot;Dr. Murray was cooperative and provided information which will aid the investigation.&quot;\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nAn attorney accompanied Murray to the lengthy meeting, the Associated Press reports.\n&quot;Dr. Murray is considered to be a witness to the events surrounding Michael Jackson&apos;s death and he is not a suspect,&quot; Houston law firm Stradley,&quot; Chernoff &amp; Alford said in a statement.\n&quot;Dr. Murray hired legal counsel to help guide him through the police investigation process. The law firm was hired to make sure the police investigation is conducted properly.&quot;\nIn a statement to the Associated Press, Murray&apos;s spokeswoman Miranda Sevcik added that the doctor &quot;helped identify the circumstances around the death of the pop icon and clarified some inconsistencies. Investigators say the doctor is in no way a suspect and remains a witness to this tragedy.&quot;\nMurray has been in Los Angeles since Jackson&apos;s death and plans to stay here until his cooperation is no longer needed, the rep added.  \nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nQuestions continue to grow about Murray&apos;s involvement in Jackson&apos;s life.  Murray -- who reportedly is licensed in California, Nevada and Texas and has an office in Houston -- had treated Jackson for three years.\nTwo weeks ago -- around the time Murray reportedly announced he was shutting down his private practice -- Jackson requested that Murray be with him, according to reports. He was then hired by AEG Live, which was producing Jackson&apos;s upcoming London shows.\nAccording to various media reports, Jackson was injected with the narcotic painkiller Demerol shortly before he went into cardiac arrest. Murray had performed CPR on him when paramedics arrived and accompanied the singer in an ambulance to the UCLA Medical Center, where the King of Pop was pronounced dead at 2:26 p.m. PST Thursday.  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\nInvestigative reporter Diane Dimond -- who has covered Michael Jackson for years -- said on CBS&apos; The Early Show Saturday Edition: &quot;If he was the only doctor on the scene and, as we heard in the 911 call, worked on Michael Jackson for quite awhile before they called 911, he may be culpable of something.&quot;\nThe official autopsy, conducted on Friday, failed to determine what killed Jackson. Toxicology test results, which could show the drugs present in Jackson&apos;s system, could take up to six weeks.\nOn Saturday, the Rev. Jesse Jackson said the Jackson family wants answers.   &quot;They [the Jacksons] didn&apos;t know the doctor. ... He should have met with the family, given them comfort on the last hours of their son,&quot; he said at a press conference.\nIn a quest to find answers, a second autopsy on the performer&apos;s body was performed Saturday by a private pathologist hired by the Jackson family, according to TMZ.com and The Los Angeles Times. Joe star, 27, got flak from fans - someone even vandalized her North London home - for getting involved last year with the Brothers &amp; Sisters star while he was still married to his wife Rosetta (with whom he has four children).He announced they were separating only after his romance with Miller heated up.\nThe relationship &quot;probably looked awful,&quot; Miller says in the September issue of British GQ. &quot;I probably seem like not a particularly nice person, not a girl&apos;s girl.&quot;  \nSee celebs who were caught cheating.\n&quot;I do think sometimes people get morally superior without understanding situations,&quot; she says of the criticism. &quot;And the situation I got into was not ideal, but it happened and if I could go back and be more responsible, I would.&quot;\n&quot;Well, I probably would be less naive about ignoring the fact that people care,&quot; Miller adds. &quot;I&apos;ve always kind of done exactly what my instincts said. I have a good brain on me, but I&apos;ve never really used it when it came to making decisions about love, which has been a blessing and a curse.&quot;  \nSee the wackiest romances of 2008.\nShe continues, &quot;I definitely have been foolish. I&apos;ve made apologies to people I needed to, but I can&apos;t apologize to people I don&apos;t know for things they don&apos;t understand.&quot;  \nCan you believe these couples hooked up?\nShe defends herself when asked if she is &quot;sexually manipulative.&quot;\n&quot;I&apos;m supposed to be this complete slapper, that&apos;s my reputation,&quot; she says. &quot;But actually I was in a relationship from 19 to 21 with Dave [Neville]; 21 to 24 with Jude [Law, who cheated on her with his kids&apos; nanny]; then 25 to 26 with Rhys [Ifan], and then Balthazar.&quot;\n&quot;And then a few dalliances, three months here and there, but I&apos;ve never been like a shagger,&quot; she says. &quot;I&apos;ve actually been kind of single for the past year. I&apos;ve had somebody on the end of the phone maybe, but I haven&apos;t been living with anyone or been in a proper relationship, and it&apos;s been really great.&quot;\n&quot;I&apos;m completely on https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/brother-david-carradine-was-the-greatest-maverick-200956/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/brother-david-carradine-was-the-greatest-maverick-200956/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/brother-david-carradine-was-the-greatest-maverick-200956/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Brother: David Carradine Was the &#8220;Greatest Maverick&#8221;", "datePublished": "2009-06-05T19:11:02-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:55:24-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Bruce shares his memories of the late Kung Fu and Kill Bill star with Us", "articleBody": "One day after David Carradine was found dead -- some newspapers reported he committed suicide, but his manager denied the claims -- in the Thai capital, Bangkok, his older brother Bruce Carradine, 76, tells Usmagazine.com about the Kung Fu actor.\r\nWhat did David mean to you? As you can imagine, this is very hard. All together there were five of us that had the Carradine name. David had a lot of admiration for his father as an actor, and his mother he loved very dearly. We have all been close and we all love each other. There has never been any animosity or negative tension. Everyone did well in their own fields.   David is the greatest maverick. He was a maverick from the beginning. I remember when we went to private school, back in the &apos;40s.  A school for boys, everybody had to take a shower before dinner. David never liked to do the conventional and he refused, and they ended up taking him forcibly and putting him in the shower. I remember that.\r\nWhat is your favorite memory of him? This is not a favorite memory, but, you know. I remember in one instance when he had made an unfortunate decision during one of his relationships. David realized what he had done wasn&apos;t the wisest thing to do. His form of penance was to sleep on top of his grand piano, with no cushions and no blanket for a month.\r\nSee Us Weekly&apos;s photo tribute to stars who have gone too soon\r\nWhat was he most passionate about? He was definitely his own individual and guarded fiercely his own viewpoints. He was an idealist in many ways. He got a hold of kung fu, as we know. He was chosen by Jerry Thorpe who saw him on a Broadway play called Royal Hunt to the Sun. Jerry proposed the part in the Kung Fu series. He made a commitment to only do three years no matter how good or bad it was. He probably could have done it a little longer.   He one time said to me, &apos;Bruce, I would die for my beliefs.&apos; He got into more than one fight with directors. Once there was a director that was being unkind to a member of the crew, and David told him to stop. They got into it.\r\nDid he have a lot of things he struggled with in life? He made a few wrong turns in his life. We all make wrong turns in life. We all have. But, being a celebrity it sometimes got pretty public. He admitted and declared publicly that he was arrogant, but he didn&apos;t brag. He was very proud. When you become an actor, you put yourself out on the front line. You&apos;re subject to rejection. It&apos;s very difficult on the spirit.   Our father one time said, &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x2DC;If you can be anything else, don&apos;t be an actor.&apos; He meant, you have to be driven so much to be an actor. When he left kung fu, he later said, &apos;Bruce, I&apos;ve lost a lot of opportunity in Hollywood because of my insensitivities and my arrogance. I realize that now.&apos; He said that like 15 to 20 years ago. Like all of us, he struggled with his demons, but they were larger than life in many instances. Being that his life as an actor was larger than life.\r\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\r\nWhat type of father was he? BC: He was on a talk show 25 years ago, and they asked him if he was a good father. He said, &apos;No, I&apos;m just a father.&apos; I think the problem with actors, especially when they reach those heights ... David, I think he did what he could. Some of these people are so complex and so absorbed in their own lives, they have to constantly prepare for their next part -- trying to figure out how to get a part and how to survive. I think it&apos;s difficult for someone like that to be a father. They&apos;re gone on shoots. They reach the peaks of success of achievement, and during the hard times they reach the depths of despair.\r\nWhat do you know about his death at this point? Honestly, I only know what I read. I don&apos;t know any particulars. The fact that they said his hands were tied behind his back was rather suspicious. I actually got a call from a radio station in Colombia this morning. At the very end, I said I&apos;d like to read something if I may. I said it&apos;s from the Book of Revelations, the 21:1-4 [&quot;...And God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.&quot;]. I find it very comforting.", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/brother-david-carradine-was-the-greatest-maverick-200956/#webpage"}, "image": {"@type": "ImageObject", County Coroner, the L.A. District Attorney and the L.A. Police Department,&quot; the family told Usmagazine.com in a statement on Monday.\r\n\r\nThe homicide ruling makes it likely criminal charges will be brought against Conrad Murray, the physician who admitted he administered a powerful anesthetic propofol the morning he died. Detectives have been investigating whether Murray&apos;s decision to administer Jackson propofol outside a hospital and as a sleep aid would be classified as negligence for an involuntary manslaughter charge.\r\n&quot;The family looks forward to the day that justice can be served,&quot; the statement continued.\r\n\r\nThe Los Angeles coroner&apos;s office found lethal levels of propofol in Jackson&apos;s body after he died, according to a search warrant affidavit unsealed in a Houston court Monday.\r\nThe official coroner&apos;s report is sealed at the request of the Los Angeles Police Department due to the ongoing investigation.\r\n\r\nIn July, one week after Los Angeles police confirmed that investigators had not ruled out homicide, the King of Pop&apos;s older sister, La Toya Jackson, first revealed her suspicions.\r\n&quot;I believe Michael was murdered,&quot; she had said. &quot;I felt that from the start. Not just one person was involved, rather it was a conspiracy of people. He was surrounded by a bad circle. Michael was a very meek, quiet, loving person. People took advantage of that. she told Good Morning America in an interview that aired Tuesday.  &quot;I just wanted to kind of get rid of this whole thing for me,&quot; she said of the prophylactic double mastectomy. &quot;This was the choice that I made and it was a tough one. My decision, after looking at all the treatment plans that were possibilities for me, the only one that seemed the most logical and the one that was going to work for me was to have a bilateral mastectomy,&quot; she explained.\r\nApplegate, the 36-year-old star who will return to work on her ABC sitcom Samantha Who? in mid-September, is now &quot;absolutely 100 percent clear and clean&quot; of cancer and planning reconstructive surgery.\r\n&quot;I&apos;m going to have cute boobs &apos;til I&apos;m 90, so there&apos;s that,&quot; she joked. &quot;I&apos;ll have the best boobs in the nursing home. I&apos;ll be the envy of all the ladies around the bridge table.&quot;\r\nThe decision was an emotional one.\r\n&quot;Sometimes, you know, I cry,&quot; she said. &quot;And sometimes I scream. And I get really angry. And I get really upset, you know, into wallowing in self-pity sometimes. And I think that it&apos;s all part of the healing.&quot;\r\nApplegate said she gained insight into the disease from her mom, Nancy Priddy, a repeat breast cancer survivor.\r\n&quot;She&apos;s been sort of this quiet warrior in the back and has been a great support, and just telling me that I was going to be OK,&quot; she said. &quot;And I knew I was going to be OK. I&apos;ve watched her. I&apos;ve watched her have a mastectomy, and then I&apos;ve watched her go through two years of chemotherapy and eight surgeries and a hysterectomy,&quot; Applegate added. &quot;I&apos;ve watched this woman survive both those things. So, for me, there was always that sense that I was going to be OK, no matter what.&quot;\r\nThe actress&apos; cancer was discovered earlier this year during a follow-up exam.\r\n&quot;If this had been We&apos;re investigating a complaint,&quot; Troy Thompson of the Pennsylvania Department of Labor tells Usmagazine.com. &quot;We&apos;re not saying that there was or was not a violation, just that we&apos;re conducting an investigation.&quot;  In a statement, a TLC rep said: &quot;TLC fully complies with all applicable laws and regulations.  Jon and Kate + 8 is no exception.  For an extended period of time, we have been engaged in cooperative discussions and supplied all requested information to the Pennsylvania Department of Labor.  We will continue to engage the appropriate officials and meet any standards or regulations that are applicable to TLC productions.&quot;\r\nSee Jon and Gosselin through the years\r\nThe reality show -- for which Jon and Kate earn $50,000-$75,000 an episode -- features their eight children, including 8-year-old twins and sextuplets who just turned 5. (Monday&apos;s season five premiere drew a record  9.8 million viewers.)  Being on the show means the kids might be exempt from standards such as how many hours they can work per day. They&apos;re just going about their regular  lives.&quot;\r\nSee photos of reality love gone bad\r\nEarlier this week, Kate&apos;s brother and sister-in-law said they fear the emotional toll the show is taking on the children.  &quot;They&apos;re being viewed as a commodity,&quot; Kevin Kreider, Kate&apos;s younger brother, said on CBS&apos; Early Show Wednesday. The pair were romantically linked at the time.\r\n\r\nAnother connection? Rodriguez, Madonna, and Kravitz all have the same manager: Guy Oseary.\r\nOseary sat in Rodriguez&apos;s seats at a Yankees game with Madonna and her kids on June 22.\r\nKravitz attended Madonna&apos;s private showcase of her latest album, Hard Candy, in Paris on May 6.
